1# SPLICE CEP Extension Build Infrastructure
     2
     3This directory contains the build infrastructure for creating distributable installers for the SPLICE CEP extension.
     4
     5## Directory Structure
     6
     7```
     8build/
     9 scripts/
    10    build-all.sh           # Master build script
    11    create-certificate.sh  # One-time ZXP certificate creation
    12    sign-extension.sh      # Signs CEP extension with ZXPSignCmd
    13    build-macos.sh         # Creates .pkg installer
    14    build-windows.sh       # Creates .exe installer (NSIS)
    15 installers/
    16    macos/
    17       distribution.xml   # productbuild distribution file
    18       welcome.html       # Installer welcome page
    19       license.html       # License agreement
    20       conclusion.html    # Installation complete page
    21    windows/
    22        splice-installer.nsi  # NSIS installer script
    23        license.txt        # License for Windows installer
    24 certificates/              # ZXP certificates (gitignored)
    25    .gitkeep
    26 output/                    # Build output (gitignored)
    27     .gitkeep
    28```
    29
    30## Prerequisites
    31
    32### Required Tools
    33
    341. **ZXPSignCmd** - Adobe's extension signing tool
    35   - Download from: https://github.com/AdobeDocs/adobeio-runtime/blob/master/resources/ZXPSignCmd.md
    36   - Add to PATH or place in `/usr/local/bin/`
    37
    382. **For macOS Installers:**
    39   - Xcode Command Line Tools: `xcode-select --install`
    40   - This provides `pkgbuild` and `productbuild`
    41
    423. **For Windows Installers:**
    43   - NSIS: https://nsis.sourceforge.io/Download
    44   - macOS: `brew install nsis`
    45   - Linux: `sudo apt-get install nsis`
    46
    47### Optional Tools (for signing)
    48
    49- **macOS Signing:** Apple Developer ID Installer certificate
    50- **macOS Notarization:** Apple ID with app-specific password
    51- **Windows Signing:** Code signing certificate (.pfx file)
    52- **Cross-platform Windows Signing:** `osslsigncode` (`brew install osslsigncode`)
    53
    54## Quick Start
    55
    56### Development Build (No Signing)
    57
    58```bash
    59# Create a development build
    60./build/scripts/build-all.sh --dev
    61```
    62
    63### Production Build
    64
    65```bash
    66# 1. First, create a certificate (one-time)
    67export ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD="your-secure-password"
    68./build/scripts/create-certificate.sh
    69
    70# 2. Build everything
    71./build/scripts/build-all.sh
    72```
    73
    74## Environment Variables
    75
    76| Variable | Description | Required |
    77|----------|-------------|----------|
    78| `ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD` | Password for ZXP certificate | For signing |
    79| `APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID` | Apple Developer ID Installer cert | For macOS signing |
    80| `APPLE_ID` | Apple ID for notarization | For notarization |
    81| `APPLE_TEAM_ID` | Apple Team ID | For notarization |
    82| `APPLE_APP_PASSWORD` | App-specific password | For notarization |
    83| `WINDOWS_CERT_PATH` | Path to .pfx certificate | For Windows signing |
    84| `WINDOWS_CERT_PASSWORD` | Windows certificate password | For Windows signing |
    85
    86## Build Scripts
    87
    88### `build-all.sh` - Master Build Script
    89
    90Orchestrates the complete build process.
    91
    92```bash
    93./build/scripts/build-all.sh [options]
    94
    95Options:
    96  --skip-sign      Skip extension signing
    97  --skip-macos     Skip macOS installer build
    98  --skip-windows   Skip Windows installer build
    99  --unsigned       Create unsigned installers
   100  --dev            Development build (no signing)
   101  --clean          Clean build directories first
   102  --help           Show help
   103```
   104
   105### `create-certificate.sh` - Certificate Creation
   106
   107Creates a self-signed certificate for signing CEP extensions.
   108
   109```bash
   110./build/scripts/create-certificate.sh [--force]
   111```
   112
   113### `sign-extension.sh` - Extension Signing
   114
   115Signs the CEP extension to create a .zxp file.
   116
   117```bash
   118./build/scripts/sign-extension.sh [--dev]
   119```
   120
   121### `build-macos.sh` - macOS Installer
   122
   123Creates a .pkg installer for macOS.
   124
   125```bash
   126./build/scripts/build-macos.sh [--unsigned]
   127```
   128
   129### `build-windows.sh` - Windows Installer
   130
   131Creates an .exe installer using NSIS.
   132
   133```bash
   134./build/scripts/build-windows.sh [--unsigned]
   135```
   136
   137## Output Files
   138
   139After a successful build, the following files are created in `build/output/`:
   140
   141| File | Description |
   142|------|-------------|
   143| `splice-v{VERSION}.zxp` | Signed CEP extension (for manual installation) |
   144| `SPLICE-v{VERSION}.pkg` | macOS installer |
   145| `SPLICE-v{VERSION}-Setup.exe` | Windows installer |
   146
   147## CI/CD Integration
   148
   149For automated builds, set the required environment variables as secrets:
   150
   151```yaml
   152# Example GitHub Actions workflow
   153env:
   154  ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD }}
   155  APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID }}
   156  APPLE_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_ID }}
   157  APPLE_TEAM_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_TEAM_ID }}
   158  APPLE_APP_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.APPLE_APP_PASSWORD }}
   159```
   160
   161## Troubleshooting
   162
   163### ZXPSignCmd Not Found
   164
   1651. Download ZXPSignCmd from Adobe
   1662. Add to PATH: `export PATH="$PATH:/path/to/ZXPSignCmd"`
   1673. Or install to: `sudo cp ZXPSignCmd /usr/local/bin/ && sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/ZXPSignCmd`
   168
   169### NSIS Not Found
   170
   171- macOS: `brew install nsis`
   172- Linux: `sudo apt-get install nsis`
   173- Windows: Download from https://nsis.sourceforge.io/Download
   174
   175### macOS Gatekeeper Warnings
   176
   177Without Apple Developer ID signing and notarization, users will see Gatekeeper warnings. To avoid this:
   178
   1791. Get an Apple Developer ID ($99/year)
   1802. Set `APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID` environment variable
   1813. Set notarization credentials (`APPLE_ID`, `APPLE_TEAM_ID`, `APPLE_APP_PASSWORD`)
   182
   183### Windows SmartScreen Warnings
   184
   185Without code signing, users may see SmartScreen warnings. To avoid this:
   186
   1871. Purchase a code signing certificate
   1882. Set `WINDOWS_CERT_PATH` and `WINDOWS_CERT_PASSWORD`
   189
   190## Version Information
   191
   192The build scripts automatically extract the version from `splice-cep/CSXS/manifest.xml` (ExtensionBundleVersion attribute).
   193
   194Current version: See `splice-cep/CSXS/manifest.xml`
   195

</system-reminder>

# SPLICE CEP Extension Build Infrastructure

This directory contains the build infrastructure for creating distributable installers for the SPLICE CEP extension.

## Directory Structure

```
build/
 scripts/
    build-all.sh           # Master build script
    create-certificate.sh  # One-time ZXP certificate creation
    sign-extension.sh      # Signs CEP extension with ZXPSignCmd
    build-macos.sh         # Creates .pkg installer
    build-windows.sh       # Creates .exe installer (NSIS)
 installers/
    macos/
       distribution.xml   # productbuild distribution file
       welcome.html       # Installer welcome page
       license.html       # License agreement
       conclusion.html    # Installation complete page
    windows/
        splice-installer.nsi  # NSIS installer script
        license.txt        # License for Windows installer
 certificates/              # ZXP certificates (gitignored)
    .gitkeep
 output/                    # Build output (gitignored)
     .gitkeep
```

## Prerequisites

### Required Tools

1. **ZXPSignCmd** - Adobe's extension signing tool
   - Download from: https://github.com/AdobeDocs/adobeio-runtime/blob/master/resources/ZXPSignCmd.md
   - Add to PATH or place in `/usr/local/bin/`

2. **For macOS Installers:**
   - Xcode Command Line Tools: `xcode-select --install`
   - This provides `pkgbuild` and `productbuild`

3. **For Windows Installers:**
   - NSIS: https://nsis.sourceforge.io/Download
   - macOS: `brew install nsis`
   - Linux: `sudo apt-get install nsis`

### Optional Tools (for signing)

- **macOS Signing:** Apple Developer ID Installer certificate
- **macOS Notarization:** Apple ID with app-specific password
- **Windows Signing:** Code signing certificate (.pfx file)
- **Cross-platform Windows Signing:** `osslsigncode` (`brew install osslsigncode`)

## Quick Start

### Development Build (No Signing)

```bash
# Create a development build
./build/scripts/build-all.sh --dev
```

### Production Build

```bash
# 1. First, create a certificate (one-time)
export ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD="your-secure-password"
./build/scripts/create-certificate.sh

# 2. Build everything
./build/scripts/build-all.sh
```

## Environment Variables

| Variable | Description | Required |
|----------|-------------|----------|
| `ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD` | Password for ZXP certificate | For signing |
| `APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID` | Apple Developer ID Installer cert | For macOS signing |
| `APPLE_ID` | Apple ID for notarization | For notarization |
| `APPLE_TEAM_ID` | Apple Team ID | For notarization |
| `APPLE_APP_PASSWORD` | App-specific password | For notarization |
| `WINDOWS_CERT_PATH` | Path to .pfx certificate | For Windows signing |
| `WINDOWS_CERT_PASSWORD` | Windows certificate password | For Windows signing |

## Build Scripts

### `build-all.sh` - Master Build Script

Orchestrates the complete build process.

```bash
./build/scripts/build-all.sh [options]

Options:
  --skip-sign      Skip extension signing
  --skip-macos     Skip macOS installer build
  --skip-windows   Skip Windows installer build
  --unsigned       Create unsigned installers
  --dev            Development build (no signing)
  --clean          Clean build directories first
  --help           Show help
```

### `create-certificate.sh` - Certificate Creation

Creates a self-signed certificate for signing CEP extensions.

```bash
./build/scripts/create-certificate.sh [--force]
```

### `sign-extension.sh` - Extension Signing

Signs the CEP extension to create a .zxp file.

```bash
./build/scripts/sign-extension.sh [--dev]
```

### `build-macos.sh` - macOS Installer

Creates a .pkg installer for macOS.

```bash
./build/scripts/build-macos.sh [--unsigned]
```

### `build-windows.sh` - Windows Installer

Creates an .exe installer using NSIS.

```bash
./build/scripts/build-windows.sh [--unsigned]
```

## Output Files

After a successful build, the following files are created in `build/output/`:

| File | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `splice-v{VERSION}.zxp` | Signed CEP extension (for manual installation) |
| `SPLICE-v{VERSION}.pkg` | macOS installer |
| `SPLICE-v{VERSION}-Setup.exe` | Windows installer |

## CI/CD Integration

For automated builds, set the required environment variables as secrets:

```yaml
# Example GitHub Actions workflow
env:
  ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD }}
  APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID }}
  APPLE_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_ID }}
  APPLE_TEAM_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_TEAM_ID }}
  APPLE_APP_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.APPLE_APP_PASSWORD }}
```

## Troubleshooting

### ZXPSignCmd Not Found

1. Download ZXPSignCmd from Adobe
2. Add to PATH: `export PATH="$PATH:/path/to/ZXPSignCmd"`
3. Or install to: `sudo cp ZXPSignCmd /usr/local/bin/ && sudo chmod +x /usr/local/bin/ZXPSignCmd`

### NSIS Not Found

- macOS: `brew install nsis`
- Linux: `sudo apt-get install nsis`
- Windows: Download from https://nsis.sourceforge.io/Download

### macOS Gatekeeper Warnings

Without Apple Developer ID signing and notarization, users will see Gatekeeper warnings. To avoid this:

1. Get an Apple Developer ID ($99/year)
2. Set `APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID` environment variable
3. Set notarization credentials (`APPLE_ID`, `APPLE_TEAM_ID`, `APPLE_APP_PASSWORD`)

### Windows SmartScreen Warnings

Without code signing, users may see SmartScreen warnings. To avoid this:

1. Purchase a code signing certificate
2. Set `WINDOWS_CERT_PATH` and `WINDOWS_CERT_PASSWORD`

## Version Information

The build scripts automatically extract the version from `splice-cep/CSXS/manifest.xml` (ExtensionBundleVersion attribute).

Current version: See `splice-cep/CSXS/manifest.xml`

1#!/bin/bash
     2#
     3# SPLICE Plugin - macOS PKG Installer Build Script
     4# Builds a signed .pkg installer using pkgbuild and productbuild
     5#
     6
     7set -e
     8
     9# Script directory
    10SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
    11PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
    12INSTALLER_DIR="$SCRIPT_DIR"
    13
    14# Source directories
    15CEP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-cep"
    16UXP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-plugin"
    17SHARED_ASSETS="$SCRIPT_DIR/../shared/assets"
    18
    19# Build directories
    20BUILD_DIR="$INSTALLER_DIR/build"
    21STAGING_DIR="$BUILD_DIR/staging"
    22OUTPUT_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/dist"
    23
    24# Version info
    25VERSION_FILE="$SCRIPT_DIR/../shared/version.json"
    26if [ -f "$VERSION_FILE" ]; then
    27    VERSION=$(grep -o '"version"[[:space:]]*:[[:space:]]*"[^"]*"' "$VERSION_FILE" | cut -d'"' -f4)
    28else
    29    VERSION="6.0.3"
    30fi
    31
    32# Package identifiers
    33BUNDLE_ID="com.splice.panel"
    34CEP_PKG_ID="${BUNDLE_ID}.cep"
    35UXP_PKG_ID="${BUNDLE_ID}.uxp"
    36
    37# Signing identity (set via environment or parameter)
    38SIGNING_IDENTITY="${SIGNING_IDENTITY:-}"
    39NOTARIZE="${NOTARIZE:-false}"
    40APPLE_ID="${APPLE_ID:-}"
    41TEAM_ID="${TEAM_ID:-}"
    42APP_PASSWORD="${APP_PASSWORD:-}"
    43
    44# Output filenames
    45PKG_NAME="SPLICE-Installer-${VERSION}.pkg"
    46UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME="SPLICE-Installer-${VERSION}-unsigned.pkg"
    47
    48# Colors for output
    49RED='\033[0;31m'
    50GREEN='\033[0;32m'
    51YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
    52NC='\033[0m' # No Color
    53
    54log_info() {
    55    echo -e "${GREEN}[INFO]${NC} $1"
    56}
    57
    58log_warn() {
    59    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARN]${NC} $1"
    60}
    61
    62log_error() {
    63    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
    64}
    65
    66# Show usage
    67usage() {
    68    echo "Usage: $0 [OPTIONS]"
    69    echo ""
    70    echo "Options:"
    71    echo "  --sign IDENTITY     Sign package with Developer ID Installer certificate"
    72    echo "  --notarize          Notarize the signed package (requires --sign)"
    73    echo "  --apple-id EMAIL    Apple ID for notarization"
    74    echo "  --team-id ID        Team ID for notarization"
    75    echo "  --password PWD      App-specific password for notarization"
    76    echo "  --help              Show this help message"
    77    echo ""
    78    echo "Environment variables:"
    79    echo "  SIGNING_IDENTITY    Developer ID Installer certificate name"
    80    echo "  NOTARIZE            Set to 'true' to notarize"
    81    echo "  APPLE_ID            Apple ID email"
    82    echo "  TEAM_ID             Apple Developer Team ID"
    83    echo "  APP_PASSWORD        App-specific password for notarization"
    84    exit 1
    85}
    86
    87# Parse arguments
    88while [[ $# -gt 0 ]]; do
    89    case $1 in
    90        --sign)
    91            SIGNING_IDENTITY="$2"
    92            shift 2
    93            ;;
    94        --notarize)
    95            NOTARIZE="true"
    96            shift
    97            ;;
    98        --apple-id)
    99            APPLE_ID="$2"
   100            shift 2
   101            ;;
   102        --team-id)
   103            TEAM_ID="$2"
   104            shift 2
   105            ;;
   106        --password)
   107            APP_PASSWORD="$2"
   108            shift 2
   109            ;;
   110        --help)
   111            usage
   112            ;;
   113        *)
   114            log_error "Unknown option: $1"
   115            usage
   116            ;;
   117    esac
   118done
   119
   120# Cleanup previous builds
   121cleanup() {
   122    log_info "Cleaning up previous builds..."
   123    rm -rf "$BUILD_DIR"
   124    mkdir -p "$BUILD_DIR"
   125    mkdir -p "$STAGING_DIR"
   126    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
   127}
   128
   129# Stage CEP extension files
   130stage_cep() {
   131    log_info "Staging CEP extension..."
   132    
   133    if [ ! -d "$CEP_SOURCE" ]; then
   134        log_error "CEP source directory not found: $CEP_SOURCE"
   135        exit 1
   136    fi
   137    
   138    # Create staging structure
   139    local cep_staging="$STAGING_DIR/cep/tmp/splice-installer/cep"
   140    mkdir -p "$cep_staging"
   141    
   142    # Copy CEP extension files
   143    cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE/CSXS" "$cep_staging/"
   144    cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE/jsx" "$cep_staging/"
   145    cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE/panel" "$cep_staging/"
   146    
   147    # Copy additional files if they exist
   148    [ -f "$CEP_SOURCE/.debug" ] && cp "$CEP_SOURCE/.debug" "$cep_staging/"
   149    [ -f "$CEP_SOURCE/mimetype" ] && cp "$CEP_SOURCE/mimetype" "$cep_staging/"
   150    
   151    log_info "CEP extension staged"
   152}
   153
   154# Stage UXP plugin files and create CCX
   155stage_uxp() {
   156    log_info "Staging UXP plugin..."
   157    
   158    if [ ! -d "$UXP_SOURCE" ]; then
   159        log_warn "UXP source directory not found: $UXP_SOURCE"
   160        log_warn "Skipping UXP plugin packaging"
   161        return 0
   162    fi
   163    
   164    # Create staging structure
   165    local uxp_staging="$STAGING_DIR/uxp/tmp/splice-installer"
   166    mkdir -p "$uxp_staging"
   167    
   168    # Create CCX package (essentially a zip with .ccx extension)
   169    local ccx_temp="$BUILD_DIR/ccx-temp"
   170    mkdir -p "$ccx_temp"
   171    
   172    # Copy UXP plugin files
   173    cp -R "$UXP_SOURCE"/* "$ccx_temp/"
   174    
   175    # Create the CCX file
   176    pushd "$ccx_temp" > /dev/null
   177    zip -r "$uxp_staging/splice-uxp.ccx" . -x "*.DS_Store" -x "__MACOSX/*"
   178    popd > /dev/null
   179    
   180    rm -rf "$ccx_temp"
   181    
   182    log_info "UXP plugin staged as CCX"
   183}
   184
   185# Build component packages
   186build_component_packages() {
   187    log_info "Building component packages..."
   188    
   189    # Build CEP package
   190    pkgbuild \
   191        --root "$STAGING_DIR/cep" \
   192        --identifier "$CEP_PKG_ID" \
   193        --version "$VERSION" \
   194        --scripts "$INSTALLER_DIR/scripts" \
   195        "$BUILD_DIR/splice-cep.pkg"
   196    
   197    log_info "CEP component package created"
   198    
   199    # Build UXP package if CCX was created
   200    if [ -f "$STAGING_DIR/uxp/tmp/splice-installer/splice-uxp.ccx" ]; then
   201        pkgbuild \
   202            --root "$STAGING_DIR/uxp" \
   203            --identifier "$UXP_PKG_ID" \
   204            --version "$VERSION" \
   205            "$BUILD_DIR/splice-uxp.pkg"
   206        
   207        log_info "UXP component package created"
   208    fi
   209}
   210
   211# Build product archive
   212build_product() {
   213    log_info "Building product archive..."
   214    
   215    # Prepare resources directory
   216    local resources_dir="$BUILD_DIR/resources"
   217    mkdir -p "$resources_dir"
   218    
   219    # Copy installer UI resources
   220    cp "$INSTALLER_DIR/resources/"*.html "$resources_dir/" 2>/dev/null || true
   221    
   222    # Copy shared assets
   223    if [ -d "$SHARED_ASSETS" ]; then
   224        cp "$SHARED_ASSETS/"* "$resources_dir/" 2>/dev/null || true
   225    fi
   226    
   227    # Update distribution.xml with actual package references
   228    local dist_xml="$BUILD_DIR/distribution.xml"
   229    cp "$INSTALLER_DIR/distribution.xml" "$dist_xml"
   230    
   231    # Replace version placeholder
   232    sed -i '' "s/version=\"6.0.3\"/version=\"$VERSION\"/g" "$dist_xml"
   233    
   234    # Build the product
   235    local output_pkg="$OUTPUT_DIR/$UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME"
   236    
   237    productbuild \
   238        --distribution "$dist_xml" \
   239        --resources "$resources_dir" \
   240        --package-path "$BUILD_DIR" \
   241        "$output_pkg"
   242    
   243    log_info "Unsigned package created: $output_pkg"
   244}
   245
   246# Sign the package
   247sign_package() {
   248    if [ -z "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" ]; then
   249        log_warn "No signing identity provided, skipping signing"
   250        log_warn "Package will show 'unidentified developer' warning on macOS"
   251        
   252        # Rename unsigned package if not signing
   253        mv "$OUTPUT_DIR/$UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME" "$OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
   254        return 0
   255    fi
   256    
   257    log_info "Signing package with identity: $SIGNING_IDENTITY"
   258    
   259    local unsigned_pkg="$OUTPUT_DIR/$UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME"
   260    local signed_pkg="$OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
   261    
   262    productsign \
   263        --sign "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" \
   264        "$unsigned_pkg" \
   265        "$signed_pkg"
   266    
   267    # Verify signature
   268    pkgutil --check-signature "$signed_pkg"
   269    
   270    # Remove unsigned package
   271    rm "$unsigned_pkg"
   272    
   273    log_info "Package signed successfully: $signed_pkg"
   274}
   275
   276# Notarize the package
   277notarize_package() {
   278    if [ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]; then
   279        log_info "Skipping notarization"
   280        return 0
   281    fi
   282    
   283    if [ -z "$APPLE_ID" ] || [ -z "$TEAM_ID" ] || [ -z "$APP_PASSWORD" ]; then
   284        log_error "Notarization requires APPLE_ID, TEAM_ID, and APP_PASSWORD"
   285        exit 1
   286    fi
   287    
   288    log_info "Notarizing package..."
   289    
   290    local pkg_path="$OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
   291    
   292    # Submit for notarization
   293    xcrun notarytool submit "$pkg_path" \
   294        --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
   295        --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
   296        --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
   297        --wait
   298    
   299    # Staple the notarization ticket
   300    log_info "Stapling notarization ticket..."
   301    xcrun stapler staple "$pkg_path"
   302    
   303    # Verify stapling
   304    xcrun stapler validate "$pkg_path"
   305    
   306    log_info "Package notarized and stapled successfully"
   307}
   308
   309# Main build process
   310main() {
   311    echo "========================================"
   312    echo "SPLICE macOS Installer Build"
   313    echo "Version: $VERSION"
   314    echo "========================================"
   315    echo ""
   316    
   317    cleanup
   318    stage_cep
   319    stage_uxp
   320    build_component_packages
   321    build_product
   322    sign_package
   323    notarize_package
   324    
   325    echo ""
   326    echo "========================================"
   327    log_info "Build complete!"
   328    echo "Output: $OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
   329    echo "========================================"
   330}
   331
   332main
   333

</system-reminder>

            ;;
        --password)
            APP_PASSWORD="$2"
            shift 2
            ;;
        --help)
            usage
            ;;
        *)
            log_error "Unknown option: $1"
            usage
            ;;
    esac
done

# Cleanup previous builds
cleanup() {
    log_info "Cleaning up previous builds..."
    rm -rf "$BUILD_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$BUILD_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$STAGING_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
}

# Stage CEP extension files
stage_cep() {
    log_info "Staging CEP extension..."
    
    if [ ! -d "$CEP_SOURCE" ]; then
        log_error "CEP source directory not found: $CEP_SOURCE"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Create staging structure
    local cep_staging="$STAGING_DIR/cep/tmp/splice-installer/cep"
    mkdir -p "$cep_staging"
    
    # Copy CEP extension files
    cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE/CSXS" "$cep_staging/"
    cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE/jsx" "$cep_staging/"
    cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE/panel" "$cep_staging/"
    
    # Copy additional files if they exist
    [ -f "$CEP_SOURCE/.debug" ] && cp "$CEP_SOURCE/.debug" "$cep_staging/"
    [ -f "$CEP_SOURCE/mimetype" ] && cp "$CEP_SOURCE/mimetype" "$cep_staging/"
    
    log_info "CEP extension staged"
}

# Stage UXP plugin files and create CCX
stage_uxp() {
    log_info "Staging UXP plugin..."
    
    if [ ! -d "$UXP_SOURCE" ]; then
        log_warn "UXP source directory not found: $UXP_SOURCE"
        log_warn "Skipping UXP plugin packaging"
        return 0
    fi
    
    # Create staging structure
    local uxp_staging="$STAGING_DIR/uxp/tmp/splice-installer"
    mkdir -p "$uxp_staging"
    
    # Create CCX package (essentially a zip with .ccx extension)
    local ccx_temp="$BUILD_DIR/ccx-temp"
    mkdir -p "$ccx_temp"
    
    # Copy UXP plugin files
    cp -R "$UXP_SOURCE"/* "$ccx_temp/"
    
    # Create the CCX file
    pushd "$ccx_temp" > /dev/null
    zip -r "$uxp_staging/splice-uxp.ccx" . -x "*.DS_Store" -x "__MACOSX/*"
    popd > /dev/null
    
    rm -rf "$ccx_temp"
    
    log_info "UXP plugin staged as CCX"
}

# Build component packages
build_component_packages() {
    log_info "Building component packages..."
    
    # Build CEP package
    pkgbuild \
        --root "$STAGING_DIR/cep" \
        --identifier "$CEP_PKG_ID" \
        --version "$VERSION" \
        --scripts "$INSTALLER_DIR/scripts" \
        "$BUILD_DIR/splice-cep.pkg"
    
    log_info "CEP component package created"
    
    # Build UXP package if CCX was created
    if [ -f "$STAGING_DIR/uxp/tmp/splice-installer/splice-uxp.ccx" ]; then
        pkgbuild \
            --root "$STAGING_DIR/uxp" \
            --identifier "$UXP_PKG_ID" \
            --version "$VERSION" \
            "$BUILD_DIR/splice-uxp.pkg"
        
        log_info "UXP component package created"
    fi
}

# Build product archive
build_product() {
    log_info "Building product archive..."
    
    # Prepare resources directory
    local resources_dir="$BUILD_DIR/resources"
    mkdir -p "$resources_dir"
    
    # Copy installer UI resources
    cp "$INSTALLER_DIR/resources/"*.html "$resources_dir/" 2>/dev/null || true
    
    # Copy shared assets
    if [ -d "$SHARED_ASSETS" ]; then
        cp "$SHARED_ASSETS/"* "$resources_dir/" 2>/dev/null || true
    fi
    
    # Update distribution.xml with actual package references
    local dist_xml="$BUILD_DIR/distribution.xml"
    cp "$INSTALLER_DIR/distribution.xml" "$dist_xml"
    
    # Replace version placeholder
    sed -i '' "s/version=\"6.0.3\"/version=\"$VERSION\"/g" "$dist_xml"
    
    # Build the product
    local output_pkg="$OUTPUT_DIR/$UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME"
    
    productbuild \
        --distribution "$dist_xml" \
        --resources "$resources_dir" \
        --package-path "$BUILD_DIR" \
        "$output_pkg"
    
    log_info "Unsigned package created: $output_pkg"
}

# Sign the package
sign_package() {
    if [ -z "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" ]; then
        log_warn "No signing identity provided, skipping signing"
        log_warn "Package will show 'unidentified developer' warning on macOS"
        
        # Rename unsigned package if not signing
        mv "$OUTPUT_DIR/$UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME" "$OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
        return 0
    fi
    
    log_info "Signing package with identity: $SIGNING_IDENTITY"
    
    local unsigned_pkg="$OUTPUT_DIR/$UNSIGNED_PKG_NAME"
    local signed_pkg="$OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
    
    productsign \
        --sign "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" \
        "$unsigned_pkg" \
        "$signed_pkg"
    
    # Verify signature
    pkgutil --check-signature "$signed_pkg"
    
    # Remove unsigned package
    rm "$unsigned_pkg"
    
    log_info "Package signed successfully: $signed_pkg"
}

# Notarize the package
notarize_package() {
    if [ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]; then
        log_info "Skipping notarization"
        return 0
    fi
    
    if [ -z "$APPLE_ID" ] || [ -z "$TEAM_ID" ] || [ -z "$APP_PASSWORD" ]; then
        log_error "Notarization requires APPLE_ID, TEAM_ID, and APP_PASSWORD"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    log_info "Notarizing package..."
    
    local pkg_path="$OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
    
    # Submit for notarization
    xcrun notarytool submit "$pkg_path" \
        --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
        --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
        --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
        --wait
    
    # Staple the notarization ticket
    log_info "Stapling notarization ticket..."
    xcrun stapler staple "$pkg_path"
    
    # Verify stapling
    xcrun stapler validate "$pkg_path"
    
    log_info "Package notarized and stapled successfully"
}

# Main build process
main() {
    echo "========================================"
    echo "SPLICE macOS Installer Build"
    echo "Version: $VERSION"
    echo "========================================"
    echo ""
    
    cleanup
    stage_cep
    stage_uxp
    build_component_packages
    build_product
    sign_package
    notarize_package
    
    echo ""
    echo "========================================"
    log_info "Build complete!"
    echo "Output: $OUTPUT_DIR/$PKG_NAME"
    echo "========================================"
}

    # Sign with productsign
    productsign --sign "$SIGNING_IDENTITY" "$INPUT_PKG" "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        log_success "PKG signed successfully!"
    else
        log_error "Failed to sign PKG"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Verify signature
    log_info "Verifying signature..."
    pkgutil --check-signature "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        log_success "Signature verified!"
    else
        log_error "Signature verification failed!"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Notarize the PKG
notarize_pkg() {
    if [[ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]]; then
        log_warning "Skipping notarization (--no-notarize specified)"
        return
    fi
    
    # Check required credentials
    if [[ -z "$APPLE_ID" ]]; then
        log_error "Apple ID not specified! Use --apple-id or set APPLE_ID environment variable"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [[ -z "$TEAM_ID" ]]; then
        log_error "Team ID not specified! Use --team-id or set TEAM_ID environment variable"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [[ -z "$APP_PASSWORD" ]]; then
        log_error "App-specific password not specified! Use --password or set APP_PASSWORD environment variable"
        echo ""
        echo "See: installer/macos/create-app-specific-password.md for instructions"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    log_info "Submitting to Apple notary service..."
    log_info "This may take several minutes..."
    
    # Submit for notarization using notarytool (macOS 12+)
    if xcrun notarytool --version &>/dev/null; then
        # Use notarytool (preferred, macOS 12+)
        SUBMISSION_OUTPUT=$(xcrun notarytool submit "$OUTPUT_PKG" \
            --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
            --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
            --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
            --wait 2>&1)
        
        echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT"
        
        # Check if successful
        if echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT" | grep -q "status: Accepted"; then
            log_success "Notarization successful!"
        else
            log_error "Notarization failed!"
            
            # Try to get the log
            SUBMISSION_ID=$(echo "$SUBMISSION_OUTPUT" | grep "id:" | head -1 | awk '{print $2}')
            if [[ -n "$SUBMISSION_ID" ]]; then
                log_info "Fetching notarization log..."
                xcrun notarytool log "$SUBMISSION_ID" \
                    --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
                    --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
                    --password "$APP_PASSWORD"
            fi
            exit 1
        fi
    else
        # Fall back to altool (legacy)
        log_warning "notarytool not found, using altool (legacy)..."
        
        xcrun altool --notarize-app \
            --primary-bundle-id "com.splice.installer" \
            --username "$APPLE_ID" \
            --password "$APP_PASSWORD" \
            --team-id "$TEAM_ID" \
            --file "$OUTPUT_PKG"
        
        log_warning "Notarization submitted. Check status manually with:"
        echo "  xcrun altool --notarization-history 0 -u $APPLE_ID -p <password>"
    fi
}

# Staple the notarization ticket
staple_pkg() {
    if [[ "$NOTARIZE" != "true" ]]; then
        return
    fi
    
    log_info "Stapling notarization ticket to PKG..."
    
    xcrun stapler staple "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        log_success "Notarization ticket stapled successfully!"
    else
        log_error "Failed to staple notarization ticket"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Final verification
final_verification() {
    log_info "Performing final verification..."
    
    echo ""
    echo "=========================================="
    echo "PKG Signature Information:"
    echo "=========================================="
    pkgutil --check-signature "$OUTPUT_PKG"
    
    echo ""
    echo "=========================================="
    echo "Gatekeeper Assessment:"
    echo "=========================================="
    spctl --assess -vv --type install "$OUTPUT_PKG" 2>&1 || true
    
    echo ""
    log_success "All done!"
    echo ""
    echo "Signed PKG: $OUTPUT_PKG"
    echo ""
    echo "You can distribute this PKG. Users on macOS 10.15+ should be able to"
    echo "install it without any Gatekeeper warnings."
}

# Main execution
main() {
    echo ""
    echo "============================================="
    echo "  SPLICE PKG Signing and Notarization Tool  "
    echo "============================================="
    echo ""
    
    parse_args "$@"
    verify_input
    find_signing_identity
    sign_pkg
    notarize_pkg
    staple_pkg
    final_verification
}

# Run main
main "$@"

   410        fi
   411        echo ""
   412    fi

   424

   448

   450

   452    echo ""
   453}
   454

   460    echo ""
   461    echo ""
   462

   464

   466        print_warning "Deployment script not found: $deploy_script"
   467        print_info "Skipping deployment step"
   468        return 0

SPLICE CEP Extension - Master Build Script

            --help|-h)
                show_help
                exit 0
                ;;
            *)
                print_error "Unknown option: $1"
                echo "Use --help for usage information"
                exit 1
                ;;
        esac
    done
}

# Extract version from manifest.xml
get_version() {
    if [[ -f "$MANIFEST_FILE" ]]; then
        VERSION=$(grep -o 'ExtensionBundleVersion="[^"]*"' "$MANIFEST_FILE" | cut -d'"' -f2)
        if [[ -z "$VERSION" ]]; then
            VERSION="1.0.0"
        fi
    else
        VERSION="1.0.0"
    fi
    echo "$VERSION"
}

# Clean build directories
clean_build() {
    print_info "Cleaning build directories..."
    rm -rf "$OUTPUT_DIR"/*.zxp
    rm -rf "$OUTPUT_DIR"/*.pkg
    rm -rf "$OUTPUT_DIR"/*.exe
    rm -rf "$OUTPUT_DIR"/*.zip
    rm -rf "$BUILD_DIR/.staging"
    rm -rf "$BUILD_DIR/.staging-win"
    print_success "Build directories cleaned"
}

# Check prerequisites
check_prerequisites() {
    print_info "Checking prerequisites..."
    
    # Check for CEP source
    if [[ ! -d "$CEP_SOURCE" ]]; then
        print_error "CEP source directory not found: $CEP_SOURCE"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [[ ! -f "$MANIFEST_FILE" ]]; then
        print_error "Manifest file not found: $MANIFEST_FILE"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    print_success "CEP source found"
    
    # Check for build scripts
    local scripts=(
        "$SCRIPT_DIR/sign-extension.sh"
        "$SCRIPT_DIR/build-macos.sh"
        "$SCRIPT_DIR/build-windows.sh"
    )
    
    for script in "${scripts[@]}"; do
        if [[ ! -f "$script" ]]; then
            print_error "Build script not found: $script"
            exit 1
        fi
        
        # Make sure scripts are executable
        chmod +x "$script"
    done
    
    print_success "Build scripts found"
    
    # Check for certificate (if not dev build)
    if [[ "$SKIP_SIGN" != "true" ]]; then
        if [[ ! -f "$CERT_DIR/splice-cert.p12" ]]; then
            print_warning "ZXP certificate not found: $CERT_DIR/splice-cert.p12"
            echo ""
            echo "Run ./build/scripts/create-certificate.sh first to create a certificate,"
            echo "or use --dev flag for development builds without signing."
            echo ""
            read -p "Continue without signing? (y/N): " response
            if [[ "$response" != "y" && "$response" != "Y" ]]; then
                exit 1
            fi
            SKIP_SIGN=true
        fi
    fi
}

# Print build configuration
print_config() {
    VERSION=$(get_version)
    
    echo ""
    print_header "Build Configuration:"
    echo "  Version:        $VERSION"
    echo "  Project Root:   $PROJECT_ROOT"
    echo "  CEP Source:     $CEP_SOURCE"
    echo "  Output Dir:     $OUTPUT_DIR"
    echo ""
    echo "  Sign Extension: $([ "$SKIP_SIGN" == "true" ] && echo "No" || echo "Yes")"
    echo "  Build macOS:    $([ "$SKIP_MACOS" == "true" ] && echo "No" || echo "Yes")"
    echo "  Build Windows:  $([ "$SKIP_WINDOWS" == "true" ] && echo "No" || echo "Yes")"
    echo "  Code Signing:   $([ "$UNSIGNED" == "true" ] && echo "No" || echo "Yes")"
    echo "  Development:    $([ "$DEV_BUILD" == "true" ] && echo "Yes" || echo "No")"
    echo ""
    
    # Show signing status
    if [[ "$SKIP_SIGN" != "true" && -n "$ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD" ]]; then
        echo "  ZXP Certificate:  Password set"
    fi
    
    if [[ "$UNSIGNED" != "true" ]]; then
        if [[ -n "$APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID" ]]; then
            echo "  Apple Developer:  $APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID"
        else
            echo "  Apple Developer:  Not set"
        fi
        
        if [[ -n "$WINDOWS_CERT_PATH" ]]; then
            echo "  Windows Cert:     $WINDOWS_CERT_PATH"
        else
            echo "  Windows Cert:     Not set"
        fi
    fi
    echo ""
}

# Sign extension
sign_extension() {
    echo ""
    echo ""
    print_header "Step 1: Signing CEP Extension"
    echo ""
    echo ""
    
    if [[ "$SKIP_SIGN" == "true" ]]; then
        print_info "Skipping extension signing"
        
        if [[ "$DEV_BUILD" == "true" ]]; then
            print_info "Creating development build..."
            "$SCRIPT_DIR/sign-extension.sh" --dev
        fi
    else
        "$SCRIPT_DIR/sign-extension.sh"
    fi
}

# Build macOS installer
build_macos() {
    echo ""
    echo ""
    print_header "Step 2: Building macOS Installer"
    echo ""
    echo ""
    
    if [[ "$SKIP_MACOS" == "true" ]]; then
        print_info "Skipping macOS installer build"
        return 0
    fi
    
    # Check if we're on macOS
    if [[ "$(uname)" != "Darwin" ]]; then
        print_warning "Not running on macOS, skipping macOS installer build"
        return 0
    fi
    
    if [[ "$UNSIGNED" == "true" ]]; then
        "$SCRIPT_DIR/build-macos.sh" --unsigned
    else
        "$SCRIPT_DIR/build-macos.sh"
    fi
}

# Build Windows installer
build_windows() {
    echo ""
    echo ""
    print_header "Step 3: Building Windows Installer"
    echo ""
    echo ""
    
    if [[ "$SKIP_WINDOWS" == "true" ]]; then
        print_info "Skipping Windows installer build"
        return 0
    fi
    
    # Check for NSIS
    if ! command -v makensis &> /dev/null; then
        print_warning "NSIS (makensis) not found, skipping Windows installer build"
        echo "Install NSIS to build Windows installers:"
        echo "  macOS: brew install nsis"
        echo "  Linux: sudo apt-get install nsis"
        return 0
    fi
    
    if [[ "$UNSIGNED" == "true" ]]; then
        "$SCRIPT_DIR/build-windows.sh" --unsigned
    else
        "$SCRIPT_DIR/build-windows.sh"
    fi
}

# Print summary
print_summary() {
    VERSION=$(get_version)
    
    echo ""
    echo ""
    print_header "Build Summary"
    echo ""
    echo ""
    
    print_success "SPLICE v$VERSION build complete!"
    echo ""
    
    print_info "Output files:"
    echo ""
    
    local found_files=false
    
    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_DIR/splice-v$VERSION.zxp" ]]; then
        found_files=true
        local size=$(ls -lh "$OUTPUT_DIR/splice-v$VERSION.zxp" | awk '{print $5}')
        echo "   Signed Extension:    $OUTPUT_DIR/splice-v$VERSION.zxp ($size)"
    fi
    
    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_DIR/splice-v$VERSION-dev.zip" ]]; then
        found_files=true
        local size=$(ls -lh "$OUTPUT_DIR/splice-v$VERSION-dev.zip" | awk '{print $5}')
        echo "   Development Build:   $OUTPUT_DIR/splice-v$VERSION-dev.zip ($size)"
    fi
    
    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION.pkg" ]]; then
        found_files=true
        local size=$(ls -lh "$OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION.pkg" | awk '{print $5}')
        echo "   macOS Installer:     $OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION.pkg ($size)"
    fi
    
    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION-Setup.exe" ]]; then
        found_files=true
        local size=$(ls -lh "$OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION-Setup.exe" | awk '{print $5}')
        echo "   Windows Installer:   $OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION-Setup.exe ($size)"
    fi
    
    if [[ "$found_files" == "false" ]]; then
        print_warning "No output files found"
    fi
    
    echo ""
    
    # Distribution notes
    if [[ "$DEV_BUILD" != "true" ]]; then
        print_info "Distribution Notes:"
        echo ""
        if [[ -n "$APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID" ]]; then
            echo "   macOS: Package is signed, should pass Gatekeeper"
        else
            echo "   macOS: Package is unsigned, users will need to bypass Gatekeeper"
        fi
        
        if [[ -n "$WINDOWS_CERT_PATH" ]]; then
            echo "   Windows: Installer is signed, should pass SmartScreen"
        else
            echo "   Windows: Installer is unsigned, may trigger SmartScreen warning"
        fi
        echo ""
    fi
}

# Main execution
main() {
    echo ""
    echo ""
    echo "             SPLICE CEP Extension Build System                  "
    echo ""
    echo ""
    
    parse_args "$@"
    
    # Clean if requested
    if [[ "$CLEAN" == "true" ]]; then
        clean_build
    fi
    
    check_prerequisites
    print_config
    
    # Create output directory
    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
    
    # Execute build steps
    local start_time=$(date +%s)
    
    sign_extension
    build_macos
    build_windows
    
    # Deploy installers to website
    deploy_installers
    
    local end_time=$(date +%s)
    local duration=$((end_time - start_time))
    
    print_summary
    
    print_info "Build completed in ${duration}s"
    echo ""
}

# Deploy installers to website's public downloads folder
deploy_installers() {
    echo ""
    echo ""
    print_header "Step 4: Deploying Installers to Website"
    echo ""
    echo ""
    
    local deploy_script="$SCRIPT_DIR/deploy-installers.sh"
    
    if [[ ! -f "$deploy_script" ]]; then
        print_warning "Deployment script not found: $deploy_script"
        print_info "Skipping deployment step"
        return 0
    fi
    
    # Make sure deploy script is executable
    chmod +x "$deploy_script"
    
    # Run deployment
    "$deploy_script"
}

main "$@"

    40YELLOW='\033[1;33m'

    76# Check prerequisites
    77check_prerequisites() {
    78    print_info "Checking prerequisites..."

    80    # Check we're on macOS
    81    if [[ "$(uname)" != "Darwin" ]]; then
    82        print_error "This script must be run on macOS"

    89        echo "  xcode-select --install"

    97        exit 1
    98    fi

   100    print_success "Build tools found"

   104        print_error "CEP source directory not found: $CEP_SOURCE"
   105        exit 1
   106    fi
   107    
   108    print_success "CEP source found: $CEP_SOURCE"
   109}
   110
   111# Prepare staging directory
   112prepare_staging() {
   113    VERSION=$(get_version)
   114    
   115    print_info "Preparing staging directory..."
   116    
   117    # Clean and create staging directory
   118    rm -rf "$STAGING_DIR"
   119    mkdir -p "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH"
   120    mkdir -p "$STAGING_DIR/scripts"
   121    
   122    # Check if we have a signed .zxp file
   123    ZXP_FILE="$OUTPUT_DIR/splice-v$VERSION.zxp"
   124    
   125    if [[ -f "$ZXP_FILE" ]]; then
   126        print_info "Using signed .zxp file: $ZXP_FILE"
   127        # Extract the .zxp (it's a zip file)
   128        unzip -q "$ZXP_FILE" -d "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH"
   129    else
   130        print_warning "No signed .zxp found, using raw CEP source files"
   131        # Copy raw CEP files
   132        cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE"/* "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH/"
   133        
   134        # Remove development and test files
   135        rm -rf "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH/.debug"
   136        rm -rf "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH/.debug.rtf"
   137        rm -rf "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH/tests"
   138        rm -f "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH"/*.html
   139        find "$STAGING_DIR/payload" -name ".DS_Store" -delete
   140        find "$STAGING_DIR/payload" -name "*.map" -delete
   141    fi
   142    
   143    # Create postinstall script
   144    cat > "$STAGING_DIR/scripts/postinstall" << 'POSTINSTALL'
   145#!/bin/bash
   146# Post-installation script for SPLICE CEP Extension
   147
   148# Set correct permissions
   149INSTALL_PATH="/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel"
   150
   151if [[ -d "$INSTALL_PATH" ]]; then
   152    chmod -R 755 "$INSTALL_PATH"
   153    chown -R root:admin "$INSTALL_PATH"
   154fi
   155
   156# Kill CEF helper processes to ensure fresh load
   157pkill -f "CEPHtmlEngine" 2>/dev/null || true
   158
   159exit 0
   160POSTINSTALL
   161    chmod +x "$STAGING_DIR/scripts/postinstall"
   162    
   163    # Create preinstall script
   164    cat > "$STAGING_DIR/scripts/preinstall" << 'PREINSTALL'
   165#!/bin/bash
   166# Pre-installation script for SPLICE CEP Extension
   167
   168# Remove old installation if exists
   169INSTALL_PATH="/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel"
   170
   171if [[ -d "$INSTALL_PATH" ]]; then
   172    rm -rf "$INSTALL_PATH"
   173fi
   174
   175# Also remove user-level installation if exists
   176USER_PATH="$HOME/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel"
   177if [[ -d "$USER_PATH" ]]; then
   178    rm -rf "$USER_PATH"
   179fi
   180
   181exit 0
   182PREINSTALL
   183    chmod +x "$STAGING_DIR/scripts/preinstall"
   184    
   185    print_success "Staging directory prepared"
   186}
   187
   188# Build component package
   189build_component_pkg() {
   190    VERSION=$(get_version)
   191    
   192    print_info "Building component package..."
   193    
   194    pkgbuild \
   195        --root "$STAGING_DIR/payload" \
   196        --scripts "$STAGING_DIR/scripts" \
   197        --identifier "$BUNDLE_ID" \
   198        --version "$VERSION" \
   199        --install-location "/" \
   200        "$COMPONENT_PKG"
   201    
   202    if [[ -f "$COMPONENT_PKG" ]]; then
   203        print_success "Component package created: $COMPONENT_PKG"
   204    else
   205        print_error "Failed to create component package"
   206        exit 1
   207    fi
   208}
   209
   210# Build product archive (final .pkg)
   211build_product_pkg() {
   212    VERSION=$(get_version)
   213    UNSIGNED_FLAG="$1"
   214    
   215    UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE="$OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION-unsigned.pkg"
   216    OUTPUT_FILE="$OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION.pkg"
   217    
   218    print_info "Building product archive..."
   219    echo "  Version: $VERSION"
   220    echo "  Output: $OUTPUT_FILE"
   221    
   222    # Create output directory
   223    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
   224    
   225    # Check for distribution.xml
   226    DISTRIBUTION_FILE="$INSTALLERS_DIR/distribution.xml"
   227    
   228    if [[ -f "$DISTRIBUTION_FILE" ]]; then
   229        print_info "Using distribution.xml"
   230        
   231        # Update version in distribution.xml (create a copy)
   232        DIST_COPY="$STAGING_DIR/distribution.xml"
   233        sed "s/{{VERSION}}/$VERSION/g" "$DISTRIBUTION_FILE" > "$DIST_COPY"
   234        
   235        # Build unsigned package first
   236        productbuild \
   237            --distribution "$DIST_COPY" \
   238            --package-path "$STAGING_DIR" \
   239            "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE"
   240    else
   241        print_warning "No distribution.xml found, building simple package"
   242        
   243        # Build unsigned package first
   244        productbuild \
   245            --component-plist "$STAGING_DIR/component.plist" 2>/dev/null || \
   246        productbuild \
   247            --package "$COMPONENT_PKG" \
   248            "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE"
   249    fi
   250    
   251    # Check if unsigned package was created
   252    if [[ ! -f "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE" ]]; then
   253        print_error "Failed to create unsigned product archive"
   254        exit 1
   255    fi
   256    
   257    # Sign the package if certificate is provided
   258    if [[ -n "$APPLE_INSTALLER_CERTIFICATE_NAME" && "$UNSIGNED_FLAG" != "--unsigned" ]]; then
   259        print_info "Signing package with Developer ID: $APPLE_INSTALLER_CERTIFICATE_NAME"
   260        
   261        productsign \
   262            --sign "$APPLE_INSTALLER_CERTIFICATE_NAME" \
   263            "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE" \
   264            "$OUTPUT_FILE"
   265        
   266        if [[ ! -f "$OUTPUT_FILE" ]]; then
   267            print_error "Failed to sign package"
   268            exit 1
   269        fi
   270        
   271        # Verify signature
   272        print_info "Verifying package signature..."
   273        pkgutil --check-signature "$OUTPUT_FILE"
   274        
   275        # Verify with Gatekeeper
   276        print_info "Verifying with Gatekeeper..."
   277        spctl -a -v -t install "$OUTPUT_FILE"
   278        
   279        # Remove unsigned package
   280        rm "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE"
   281        
   282        print_success "Package signed and verified successfully!"
   283    else
   284        if [[ "$UNSIGNED_FLAG" != "--unsigned" && -z "$APPLE_INSTALLER_CERTIFICATE_NAME" ]]; then
   285            print_warning "No APPLE_INSTALLER_CERTIFICATE_NAME set, creating unsigned package"
   286        fi
   287        
   288        # Rename unsigned to final output
   289        mv "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE" "$OUTPUT_FILE"
   290    fi
   291    
   292    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_FILE" ]]; then
   293        FILE_SIZE=$(ls -lh "$OUTPUT_FILE" | awk '{print $5}')
   294        print_success "Product archive created!"
   295        echo ""
   296        echo "  Output: $OUTPUT_FILE"
   297        echo "  Size: $FILE_SIZE"
   298    else
   299        print_error "Failed to create product archive"
   300        exit 1
   301    fi
   302}
   303
   304# Notarize the package
   305notarize_pkg() {
   306    VERSION=$(get_version)
   307    OUTPUT_FILE="$OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION.pkg"
   308    
   309    # Check for notarization credentials
   310    if [[ -z "$APPLE_ID" || -z "$APPLE_TEAM_ID" || -z "$APPLE_APP_PASSWORD" ]]; then
   311        print_warning "Notarization credentials not set (APPLE_ID, APPLE_TEAM_ID, APPLE_APP_PASSWORD)"
   312        print_info "Skipping notarization"
   313        return 0
   314    fi
   315    
   316    print_info "Submitting package for notarization..."
   317    
   318    # Submit for notarization
   319    xcrun notarytool submit "$OUTPUT_FILE" \
   320        --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
   321        --team-id "$APPLE_TEAM_ID" \
   322        --password "$APPLE_APP_PASSWORD" \
   323        --wait
   324    
   325    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
   326        print_info "Stapling notarization ticket..."
   327        xcrun stapler staple "$OUTPUT_FILE"
   328        
   329        if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
   330            print_success "Package notarized and stapled successfully!"
   331        else
   332            print_warning "Stapling failed, but package is notarized"
   333        fi
   334    else
   335        print_warning "Notarization failed, package will show Gatekeeper warnings"
   336    fi
   337}
   338
   339# Cleanup staging directory
   340cleanup() {
   341    print_info "Cleaning up staging directory..."
   342    rm -rf "$STAGING_DIR"
   343    print_success "Cleanup complete"
   344}
   345
   346# Main execution
   347main() {
   348    echo ""
   349    echo ""
   350    echo "         SPLICE macOS Installer Build Tool                  "
   351    echo ""
   352    echo ""
   353    
   354    VERSION=$(get_version)
   355    print_info "Building SPLICE v$VERSION for macOS..."
   356    echo ""
   357    
   358    check_prerequisites
   359    prepare_staging
   360    build_component_pkg
   361    build_product_pkg "$1"
   362    
   363    # Notarize if not unsigned and credentials available
   364    if [[ "$1" != "--unsigned" ]]; then
   365        notarize_pkg
   366    fi
   367    
   368    cleanup
   369    
   370    echo ""
   371    print_success "macOS installer build complete!"
   372    echo ""
   373    print_info "Output files:"
   374    ls -la "$OUTPUT_DIR"/*.pkg 2>/dev/null || echo "  (no .pkg files found)"
   375}
   376
   377main "$@"
   378

COMPONENT_PKG="$STAGING_DIR/splice-component.pkg"

# Adobe CEP extensions installation path
CEP_INSTALL_PATH="/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel"

# Bundle identifier
BUNDLE_ID="com.splice.panel"

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Print functions
print_info() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

print_success() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $1"
}

print_warning() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARNING]${NC} $1"
}

print_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# Extract version from manifest.xml
get_version() {
    if [[ -f "$MANIFEST_FILE" ]]; then
        VERSION=$(grep -o 'ExtensionBundleVersion="[^"]*"' "$MANIFEST_FILE" | cut -d'"' -f2)
        if [[ -z "$VERSION" ]]; then
            print_warning "Could not extract version from manifest.xml, using default"
            VERSION="1.0.0"
        fi
    else
        print_warning "manifest.xml not found, using default version"
        VERSION="1.0.0"
    fi
    echo "$VERSION"
}

# Check prerequisites
check_prerequisites() {
    print_info "Checking prerequisites..."
    
    # Check we're on macOS
    if [[ "$(uname)" != "Darwin" ]]; then
        print_error "This script must be run on macOS"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Check for pkgbuild
    if ! command -v pkgbuild &> /dev/null; then
        print_error "pkgbuild not found. Please install Xcode Command Line Tools:"
        echo "  xcode-select --install"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Check for productbuild
    if ! command -v productbuild &> /dev/null; then
        print_error "productbuild not found. Please install Xcode Command Line Tools:"
        echo "  xcode-select --install"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    print_success "Build tools found"
    
    # Check for CEP source
    if [[ ! -d "$CEP_SOURCE" ]]; then
        print_error "CEP source directory not found: $CEP_SOURCE"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    print_success "CEP source found: $CEP_SOURCE"
}

# Prepare staging directory
prepare_staging() {
    VERSION=$(get_version)
    
    print_info "Preparing staging directory..."
    
    # Clean and create staging directory
    rm -rf "$STAGING_DIR"
    mkdir -p "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH"
    mkdir -p "$STAGING_DIR/scripts"
    
    # Check if we have a signed .zxp file
    ZXP_FILE="$OUTPUT_DIR/splice-v$VERSION.zxp"
    
    if [[ -f "$ZXP_FILE" ]]; then
        print_info "Using signed .zxp file: $ZXP_FILE"
        # Extract the .zxp (it's a zip file)
        unzip -q "$ZXP_FILE" -d "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH"
    else
        print_warning "No signed .zxp found, using raw CEP source files"
        # Copy raw CEP files
        cp -R "$CEP_SOURCE"/* "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH/"
        
        # Remove development and test files
        rm -rf "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH/.debug"
        rm -rf "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH/.debug.rtf"
        rm -rf "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH/tests"
        rm -f "$STAGING_DIR/payload$CEP_INSTALL_PATH"/*.html
        find "$STAGING_DIR/payload" -name ".DS_Store" -delete
        find "$STAGING_DIR/payload" -name "*.map" -delete
    fi
    
    # Create postinstall script
    cat > "$STAGING_DIR/scripts/postinstall" << 'POSTINSTALL'
#!/bin/bash
# Post-installation script for SPLICE CEP Extension

# Set correct permissions
INSTALL_PATH="/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel"

if [[ -d "$INSTALL_PATH" ]]; then
    chmod -R 755 "$INSTALL_PATH"
    chown -R root:admin "$INSTALL_PATH"
fi

# Kill CEF helper processes to ensure fresh load
pkill -f "CEPHtmlEngine" 2>/dev/null || true

exit 0
POSTINSTALL
    chmod +x "$STAGING_DIR/scripts/postinstall"
    
    # Create preinstall script
    cat > "$STAGING_DIR/scripts/preinstall" << 'PREINSTALL'
#!/bin/bash
# Pre-installation script for SPLICE CEP Extension

# Remove old installation if exists
INSTALL_PATH="/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel"

if [[ -d "$INSTALL_PATH" ]]; then
    rm -rf "$INSTALL_PATH"
fi

# Also remove user-level installation if exists
USER_PATH="$HOME/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel"
if [[ -d "$USER_PATH" ]]; then
    rm -rf "$USER_PATH"
fi

exit 0
PREINSTALL
    chmod +x "$STAGING_DIR/scripts/preinstall"
    
    print_success "Staging directory prepared"
}

# Build component package
build_component_pkg() {
    VERSION=$(get_version)
    
    print_info "Building component package..."
    
    pkgbuild \
        --root "$STAGING_DIR/payload" \
        --scripts "$STAGING_DIR/scripts" \
        --identifier "$BUNDLE_ID" \
        --version "$VERSION" \
        --install-location "/" \
        "$COMPONENT_PKG"
    
    if [[ -f "$COMPONENT_PKG" ]]; then
        print_success "Component package created: $COMPONENT_PKG"
    else
        print_error "Failed to create component package"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Build product archive (final .pkg)
build_product_pkg() {
    VERSION=$(get_version)
    UNSIGNED_FLAG="$1"
    
    UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE="$OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION-unsigned.pkg"
    OUTPUT_FILE="$OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION.pkg"
    
    print_info "Building product archive..."
    echo "  Version: $VERSION"
    echo "  Output: $OUTPUT_FILE"
    
    # Create output directory
    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
    
    # Check for distribution.xml
    DISTRIBUTION_FILE="$INSTALLERS_DIR/distribution.xml"
    
    if [[ -f "$DISTRIBUTION_FILE" ]]; then
        print_info "Using distribution.xml"
        
        # Update version in distribution.xml (create a copy)
        DIST_COPY="$STAGING_DIR/distribution.xml"
        sed "s/{{VERSION}}/$VERSION/g" "$DISTRIBUTION_FILE" > "$DIST_COPY"
        
        # Build unsigned package first
        productbuild \
            --distribution "$DIST_COPY" \
            --package-path "$STAGING_DIR" \
            "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE"
    else
        print_warning "No distribution.xml found, building simple package"
        
        # Build unsigned package first
        productbuild \
            --component-plist "$STAGING_DIR/component.plist" 2>/dev/null || \
        productbuild \
            --package "$COMPONENT_PKG" \
            "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE"
    fi
    
    # Check if unsigned package was created
    if [[ ! -f "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE" ]]; then
        print_error "Failed to create unsigned product archive"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    # Sign the package if certificate is provided
    if [[ -n "$APPLE_INSTALLER_CERTIFICATE_NAME" && "$UNSIGNED_FLAG" != "--unsigned" ]]; then
        print_info "Signing package with Developer ID: $APPLE_INSTALLER_CERTIFICATE_NAME"
        
        productsign \
            --sign "$APPLE_INSTALLER_CERTIFICATE_NAME" \
            "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE" \
            "$OUTPUT_FILE"
        
        if [[ ! -f "$OUTPUT_FILE" ]]; then
            print_error "Failed to sign package"
            exit 1
        fi
        
        # Verify signature
        print_info "Verifying package signature..."
        pkgutil --check-signature "$OUTPUT_FILE"
        
        # Verify with Gatekeeper
        print_info "Verifying with Gatekeeper..."
        spctl -a -v -t install "$OUTPUT_FILE"
        
        # Remove unsigned package
        rm "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE"
        
        print_success "Package signed and verified successfully!"
    else
        if [[ "$UNSIGNED_FLAG" != "--unsigned" && -z "$APPLE_INSTALLER_CERTIFICATE_NAME" ]]; then
            print_warning "No APPLE_INSTALLER_CERTIFICATE_NAME set, creating unsigned package"
        fi
        
        # Rename unsigned to final output
        mv "$UNSIGNED_OUTPUT_FILE" "$OUTPUT_FILE"
    fi
    
    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_FILE" ]]; then
        FILE_SIZE=$(ls -lh "$OUTPUT_FILE" | awk '{print $5}')
        print_success "Product archive created!"
        echo ""
        echo "  Output: $OUTPUT_FILE"
        echo "  Size: $FILE_SIZE"
    else
        print_error "Failed to create product archive"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Notarize the package
notarize_pkg() {
    VERSION=$(get_version)
    OUTPUT_FILE="$OUTPUT_DIR/SPLICE-v$VERSION.pkg"
    
    # Check for notarization credentials
    if [[ -z "$APPLE_ID" || -z "$APPLE_TEAM_ID" || -z "$APPLE_APP_PASSWORD" ]]; then
        print_warning "Notarization credentials not set (APPLE_ID, APPLE_TEAM_ID, APPLE_APP_PASSWORD)"
        print_info "Skipping notarization"
        return 0
    fi
    
    print_info "Submitting package for notarization..."
    
    # Submit for notarization
    xcrun notarytool submit "$OUTPUT_FILE" \
        --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
        --team-id "$APPLE_TEAM_ID" \
        --password "$APPLE_APP_PASSWORD" \
        --wait
    
    if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
        print_info "Stapling notarization ticket..."
        xcrun stapler staple "$OUTPUT_FILE"
        
        if [[ $? -eq 0 ]]; then
            print_success "Package notarized and stapled successfully!"
        else
            print_warning "Stapling failed, but package is notarized"
        fi
    else
        print_warning "Notarization failed, package will show Gatekeeper warnings"
    fi
}

# Cleanup staging directory
cleanup() {
    print_info "Cleaning up staging directory..."
    rm -rf "$STAGING_DIR"
    print_success "Cleanup complete"
}

# Main execution
main() {
    echo ""
    echo ""
    echo "         SPLICE macOS Installer Build Tool                  "
    echo ""
    echo ""
    
    VERSION=$(get_version)
    print_info "Building SPLICE v$VERSION for macOS..."
    echo ""
    
    check_prerequisites
    prepare_staging
    build_component_pkg
    build_product_pkg "$1"
    
    # Notarize if not unsigned and credentials available
    if [[ "$1" != "--unsigned" ]]; then
        notarize_pkg
    fi
    
    cleanup
    
    echo ""
    print_success "macOS installer build complete!"
    echo ""
    print_info "Output files:"
    ls -la "$OUTPUT_DIR"/*.pkg 2>/dev/null || echo "  (no .pkg files found)"
}

main "$@"

#!/bin/bash
#
# SPLICE CEP Extension - Signing Script
# Signs the CEP extension using ZXPSignCmd to create a distributable .zxp file
#
# Usage: ./sign-extension.sh [--dev]
#   --dev: Create unsigned development build (no certificate required)
#
# Environment Variables:
#   ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD - Password for the certificate (required unless --dev)
#   ZXP_TIMESTAMP_URL - Timestamp server URL (default: http://timestamp.digicert.com/)
#

set -e

# Get script directory and project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
BUILD_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/build"
CERT_DIR="$BUILD_DIR/certificates"
OUTPUT_DIR="$BUILD_DIR/output"
CEP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-cep"
CERT_FILE="$CERT_DIR/splice-cert.p12"
MANIFEST_FILE="$CEP_SOURCE/CSXS/manifest.xml"

# Default timestamp server
TIMESTAMP_URL="${ZXP_TIMESTAMP_URL:-http://timestamp.digicert.com/}"

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Print functions
print_info() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

print_success() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $1"
}

print_warning() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARNING]${NC} $1"
}

print_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# Extract version from manifest.xml
get_version() {
    if [[ -f "$MANIFEST_FILE" ]]; then
        # Extract version from ExtensionBundleVersion attribute
        VERSION=$(grep -o 'ExtensionBundleVersion="[^"]*"' "$MANIFEST_FILE" | cut -d'"' -f2)
        if [[ -z "$VERSION" ]]; then
            print_warning "Could not extract version from manifest.xml, using default"
            VERSION="1.0.0"
        fi
    else
        print_warning "manifest.xml not found, using default version"
        VERSION="1.0.0"
    fi
    echo "$VERSION"
}

# Check prerequisites
check_prerequisites() {
    print_info "Checking prerequisites..."
    
    # Check for ZXPSignCmd
    if ! command -v ZXPSignCmd &> /dev/null; then
        # Check common installation locations (including project tools directory)
        local zxp_paths=(
            "$PROJECT_ROOT/tools/ZXPSignCmd"
            "/Applications/Adobe CC/ZXPSignCmd"
            "$HOME/bin/ZXPSignCmd"
            "/usr/local/bin/ZXPSignCmd"
            "./ZXPSignCmd"
        )
        
        local found=false
        for path in "${zxp_paths[@]}"; do
            if [[ -f "$path" && -x "$path" ]]; then
                export PATH="$(dirname "$path"):$PATH"
                found=true
                print_info "Found ZXPSignCmd at: $path"
                break
            fi
        done
        
        if [[ "$found" == "false" ]]; then
            print_error "ZXPSignCmd not found in PATH"
            echo ""
            echo "Please download ZXPSignCmd from Adobe and place it in:"
            echo "  $PROJECT_ROOT/tools/ZXPSignCmd"
            echo ""
            echo "Or download from:"
            echo "  https://github.com/AdobeDocs/adobeio-runtime/blob/master/resources/ZXPSignCmd.md"
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
    
    print_success "ZXPSignCmd found: $(which ZXPSignCmd)"
    
    # Check for CEP source
    if [[ ! -d "$CEP_SOURCE" ]]; then
        print_error "CEP source directory not found: $CEP_SOURCE"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    if [[ ! -f "$MANIFEST_FILE" ]]; then
        print_error "Manifest file not found: $MANIFEST_FILE"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    print_success "CEP source found: $CEP_SOURCE"
}

# Check certificate exists
check_certificate() {
    if [[ ! -f "$CERT_FILE" ]]; then
        print_error "Certificate not found: $CERT_FILE"
        echo ""
        echo "Please create a certificate first by running:"
        echo "  ./build/scripts/create-certificate.sh"
        exit 1
    fi
    
    print_success "Certificate found: $CERT_FILE"
}

# Get or prompt for password
get_password() {
    if [[ -n "$ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD" ]]; then
        PASSWORD="$ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD"
        print_info "Using password from ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD environment variable"
    else
        print_warning "No ZXP_CERT_PASSWORD environment variable set"
        echo ""
        read -s -p "Enter certificate password: " PASSWORD
        echo ""
        
        if [[ -z "$PASSWORD" ]]; then
            print_error "Password cannot be empty"
            exit 1
        fi
    fi
}

# Create development (unsigned) build
create_dev_build() {
    VERSION=$(get_version)
    OUTPUT_FILE="$OUTPUT_DIR/splice-v$VERSION-dev.zip"
    
    print_info "Creating development build (unsigned)..."
    echo "  Version: $VERSION"
    echo "  Output: $OUTPUT_FILE"
    
    # Create output directory
    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
    
    # Create zip file
    cd "$PROJECT_ROOT"
    zip -r "$OUTPUT_FILE" splice-cep \
        -x "splice-cep/.git/*" \
        -x "splice-cep/.debug" \
        -x "splice-cep/.debug.rtf" \
        -x "splice-cep/tests/*" \
        -x "splice-cep/*.html" \
        -x "*.DS_Store"
    
    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_FILE" ]]; then
        print_success "Development build created: $OUTPUT_FILE"
        echo ""
        print_warning "This is an unsigned build for development only."
        echo "Users will need to enable debug mode to install it."
    else
        print_error "Failed to create development build"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Sign the extension
sign_extension() {
    VERSION=$(get_version)
    OUTPUT_FILE="$OUTPUT_DIR/splice-v$VERSION.zxp"
    
    print_info "Signing CEP extension..."
    echo "  Version: $VERSION"
    echo "  Source: $CEP_SOURCE"
    echo "  Certificate: $CERT_FILE"
    echo "  Timestamp: $TIMESTAMP_URL"
    echo "  Output: $OUTPUT_FILE"
    echo ""
    
    # Create output directory
    mkdir -p "$OUTPUT_DIR"
    
    # Remove old signed file if exists
    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_FILE" ]]; then
        print_info "Removing existing signed extension..."
        rm -f "$OUTPUT_FILE"
    fi
    
    # Sign the extension
    print_info "Running ZXPSignCmd..."
    ZXPSignCmd -sign "$CEP_SOURCE" "$OUTPUT_FILE" "$CERT_FILE" "$PASSWORD" -tsa "$TIMESTAMP_URL"
    
    if [[ -f "$OUTPUT_FILE" ]]; then
        # Verify the signature
        print_info "Verifying signature..."
        if ZXPSignCmd -verify "$OUTPUT_FILE" > /dev/null 2>&1; then
            print_success "Signature verified!"
        else
            print_warning "Signature verification returned warnings (may still be valid)"
        fi
        
        FILE_SIZE=$(ls -lh "$OUTPUT_FILE" | awk '{print $5}')
        print_success "Extension signed successfully!"
        echo ""
        echo "  Output: $OUTPUT_FILE"
        echo "  Size: $FILE_SIZE"
        echo ""
        print_info "Next steps:"
        echo "  - Run ./build/scripts/build-macos.sh to create macOS installer"
        echo "  - Run ./build/scripts/build-windows.sh to create Windows installer"
        echo "  - Or run ./build/scripts/build-all.sh to build all installers"
    else
        print_error "Extension signing failed"
        exit 1
    fi
}

# Main execution
main() {
    echo ""
    echo ""
    echo "           SPLICE CEP Extension Signing Tool                "
    echo ""
    echo ""
    
    check_prerequisites
    
    if [[ "$1" == "--dev" ]]; then
        print_info "Creating development build (no signing)..."
        create_dev_build
    else
        check_certificate
        get_password
        sign_extension
    fi
}

main "$@"

# SPLICE Installation Guide

Welcome to SPLICE! This guide will help you install the SPLICE plugin for Adobe Premiere Pro.

## System Requirements

- **Adobe Premiere Pro**: Version 14.0 (2020) or later
- **macOS**: 10.14 Mojave or later
- **Windows**: Windows 10 (1903) or later
- **Disk Space**: 50 MB free space

## Quick Installation

### macOS

1. **Download** the installer: `SPLICE-Installer-x.x.x.pkg`
2. **Double-click** the downloaded file
3. **Follow** the on-screen instructions
4. **Restart** Premiere Pro if it's running
5. **Access SPLICE** from Window  Extensions  SPLICE

### Windows

1. **Download** the installer: `SPLICE-Installer-x.x.x.exe`
2. **Double-click** the downloaded file
3. If prompted by Windows SmartScreen, click "More info"  "Run anyway"
4. **Follow** the installation wizard
5. **Restart** Premiere Pro if it's running
6. **Access SPLICE** from Window  Extensions  SPLICE

## Detailed Installation Steps

### macOS Installation

#### Step 1: Download
Download the latest `SPLICE-Installer-x.x.x.pkg` file from the official SPLICE website or your provided download link.

#### Step 2: Run Installer
Double-click the `.pkg` file to launch the installer. If you see a message saying the app is from an unidentified developer:
1. Right-click (or Control-click) the installer
2. Select "Open" from the menu
3. Click "Open" in the dialog

#### Step 3: Follow Wizard
1. **Welcome**: Click Continue
2. **License Agreement**: Read and agree to the terms
3. **Installation Type**: Choose Standard (recommended)
4. **Install**: Enter your password when prompted
5. **Complete**: Click Close

#### Step 4: Verify Installation
1. Open Adobe Premiere Pro
2. Go to **Window  Extensions**
3. You should see **SPLICE** in the menu
4. Click it to open the SPLICE panel

### Windows Installation

#### Step 1: Download
Download the latest `SPLICE-Installer-x.x.x.exe` file from the official SPLICE website.

#### Step 2: Run Installer
Double-click the `.exe` file. If Windows SmartScreen appears:
1. Click "More info"
2. Click "Run anyway"

This happens because the installer is new and hasn't built up Windows reputation yet.

#### Step 3: Follow Wizard
1. **Welcome**: Click Next
2. **License Agreement**: Read and accept the terms
3. **Installation Location**: Keep default or choose custom
4. **Components**: Select which components to install
5. **Install**: Click Install
6. **Complete**: Click Finish

#### Step 4: Verify Installation
1. Open Adobe Premiere Pro
2. Go to **Window  Extensions**
3. You should see **SPLICE** in the menu
4. Click it to open the SPLICE panel

## What Gets Installed

### CEP Extension (All Premiere Pro Versions)
- **Location (macOS)**: `/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel/`
- **Location (Windows)**: `C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Adobe\CEP\extensions\com.splice.panel\`
- **Purpose**: Panel UI and Premiere Pro integration

### UXP Plugin (Premiere Pro 25.0+)
- **Location**: Managed by Adobe Creative Cloud
- **Purpose**: Enhanced features for Premiere Pro 2025 and later

## Uninstallation

### macOS

**Option 1: Using Uninstaller Script**
1. Open Terminal
2. Run: `"/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel/uninstall.sh"`
3. Enter your password when prompted

**Option 2: Manual Removal**
1. Open Finder
2. Go to: `/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/`
3. Delete the `com.splice.panel` folder
4. Empty Trash

### Windows

**Option 1: Via Settings**
1. Open Settings  Apps  Apps & features
2. Find "SPLICE"
3. Click Uninstall

**Option 2: Via Control Panel**
1. Open Control Panel  Programs  Programs and Features
2. Find "SPLICE"
3. Click Uninstall

## Troubleshooting

### SPLICE doesn't appear in Extensions menu

**Enable Debug Mode:**

*macOS:*
```bash
defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1
```

*Windows:*
1. Open Registry Editor (regedit)
2. Navigate to `HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Software\Adobe\CSXS.11`
3. Create a new String Value called `PlayerDebugMode`
4. Set its value to `1`

Then restart Premiere Pro.

### "Extension could not be loaded" error

1. Close Premiere Pro completely
2. Navigate to the extensions folder
3. Verify `com.splice.panel` folder exists and contains files
4. Restart Premiere Pro

### macOS: "damaged and can't be opened" error

Run this command in Terminal:
```bash
xattr -cr /path/to/SPLICE-Installer.pkg
```
Then try running the installer again.

### Windows: SmartScreen blocks the installer

1. Click "More info"
2. Click "Run anyway"

This is normal for new software that hasn't built up Windows reputation.

### Extension loads but shows blank panel

1. Check your internet connection
2. Verify firewall isn't blocking the extension
3. Try restarting Premiere Pro
4. Reinstall if issue persists

### UXP Plugin not appearing (Premiere Pro 25+)

1. Open Creative Cloud Desktop
2. Go to Stock & Marketplace  Plugins  Installed
3. Check if SPLICE appears
4. If not, the CEP extension will still work

## Getting Help

If you continue to experience issues:

1. **Documentation**: Visit our online documentation
2. **Email Support**: contact@splice.com
3. **Discord**: Join our community Discord server

When contacting support, please include:
- Your operating system and version
- Adobe Premiere Pro version
- Screenshot of any error messages
- Steps you've already tried

## Updating SPLICE

To update SPLICE:
1. Download the latest installer
2. Run it (it will update the existing installation)
3. Restart Premiere Pro

Your settings and preferences will be preserved during updates.

---

Thank you for choosing SPLICE! We hope it enhances your video editing workflow.

    32
    33; UPIA path for UXP installation
    34!define UPIA_PATH "$COMMONFILES\Adobe\Adobe Desktop Common\RemoteComponents\UPI\UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent\UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent.exe"

    59VIAddVersionKey "FileDescription" "${PRODUCT_NAME} Installer"

    61VIAddVersionKey "ProductVersion" "${PRODUCT_VERSION}"
    62
    63;--------------------------------
    64; Interface Settings
    65
    66!define MUI_ABORTWARNING
