    68!define MUI_UNICON "..\shared\assets\uninstaller-icon.ico"
    69; Note: Custom bitmaps removed for cross-platform build compatibility
    70; To use custom graphics, create 164x314 pixel BMP for sidebar and 150x57 for header
    71; !define MUI_WELCOMEFINISHPAGE_BITMAP "..\shared\assets\installer-sidebar.bmp"
    72; !define MUI_HEADERIMAGE
    73; !define MUI_HEADERIMAGE_BITMAP "..\shared\assets\installer-header.bmp"
    74; !define MUI_HEADERIMAGE_RIGHT
    75
    76;--------------------------------
    77; Pages
    78
    79; Installer pages
    80!insertmacro MUI_PAGE_WELCOME
    81!insertmacro MUI_PAGE_LICENSE "..\shared\assets\license.txt"
    82!insertmacro MUI_PAGE_DIRECTORY
    83!insertmacro MUI_PAGE_INSTFILES
    84!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_NOAUTOCLOSE
    85!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_SHOWREADME ""
    86!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_SHOWREADME_NOTCHECKED
    87!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_SHOWREADME_TEXT "Open SPLICE documentation"
    88!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_SHOWREADME_FUNCTION OpenDocumentation
    89!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_LINK "Visit spliceclips.com"
    90!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_LINK_LOCATION "${PRODUCT_WEB_SITE}"
    91!insertmacro MUI_PAGE_FINISH
    92
    93; Uninstaller pages
    94!insertmacro MUI_UNPAGE_CONFIRM
    95!insertmacro MUI_UNPAGE_INSTFILES
    96
    97;--------------------------------
    98; Languages
    99
   100!insertmacro MUI_LANGUAGE "English"
   101
   102;--------------------------------
   103; Functions
   104
   105Function .onInit
   106    ; Check if running on Windows 10 or later
   107    ${IfNot} ${AtLeastWin10}
   108        MessageBox MB_OK|MB_ICONSTOP "SPLICE requires Windows 10 or later."
   109        Abort
   110    ${EndIf}
   111    
   112    ; Check if Premiere Pro is running
   113    FindWindow $0 "" "Adobe Premiere Pro"
   114    ${If} $0 != 0
   115        MessageBox MB_YESNO|MB_ICONEXCLAMATION \
   116            "Adobe Premiere Pro is running.$\n$\nPlease close it before continuing.$\n$\nClose Premiere Pro now?" \
   117            IDYES close_premiere
   118        Abort
   119        
   120        close_premiere:
   121            ; Try to close Premiere Pro gracefully
   122            SendMessage $0 ${WM_CLOSE} 0 0
   123            Sleep 3000
   124            
   125            ; Check again
   126            FindWindow $0 "" "Adobe Premiere Pro"
   127            ${If} $0 != 0
   128                MessageBox MB_OK|MB_ICONSTOP "Premiere Pro is still running. Please close it manually and run the installer again."
   129                Abort
   130            ${EndIf}
   131    ${EndIf}
   132    
   133    ; Check for previous installation
   134    ReadRegStr $0 ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "UninstallString"
   135    ${If} $0 != ""
   136        MessageBox MB_YESNO|MB_ICONQUESTION \
   137            "A previous version of ${PRODUCT_NAME} is installed.$\n$\nWould you like to uninstall it first?" \
   138            IDNO skip_uninstall
   139        
   140        ExecWait '"$0" /S'
   141        
   142        skip_uninstall:
   143    ${EndIf}
   144FunctionEnd
   145
   146Function OpenDocumentation
   147    ExecShell "open" "${PRODUCT_SUPPORT_URL}"
   148FunctionEnd
   149
   150;--------------------------------
   151; Installer Sections
   152
   153Section "SPLICE CEP Extension" SEC_CEP
   154    SectionIn RO  ; Required section
   155    
   156    SetOutPath "$INSTDIR"
   157    
   158    ; Create installation directory
   159    CreateDirectory "$INSTDIR"
   160    
   161    ; Determine CEP path based on system architecture
   162    ${If} ${RunningX64}
   163        StrCpy $1 "${CEP_EXTENSIONS_PATH}"
   164    ${Else}
   165        StrCpy $1 "${CEP_EXTENSIONS_PATH_X86}"
   166    ${EndIf}
   167    
   168    ; Create CEP extensions directory if it doesn't exist
   169    CreateDirectory "$1"
   170    CreateDirectory "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
   171    
   172    ; Remove old installation if exists
   173    RMDir /r "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
   174    CreateDirectory "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
   175    
   176    ; Copy CEP extension files
   177    SetOutPath "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
   178    File /r "..\..\splice-cep\CSXS"
   179    File /r "..\..\splice-cep\jsx"
   180    File /r "..\..\splice-cep\panel"
   181    
   182    ; Copy optional files if they exist
   183    SetOutPath "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
   184    File /nonfatal "..\..\splice-cep\.debug"
   185    File /nonfatal "..\..\splice-cep\mimetype"
   186    
   187    ; Store CEP installation path
   188    WriteRegStr ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "CEPPath" "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
   189    
   190    DetailPrint "CEP extension installed to: $1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
   191SectionEnd
   192
   193Section "SPLICE UXP Plugin" SEC_UXP

   205    DetailPrint "Installing UXP plugin via Adobe installer..."
   206    nsExec::ExecToLog '"${UPIA_PATH}" --install "$TEMP\splice-uxp.ccx"'

   211    ${Else}

   215

; SPLICE Plugin - Windows NSIS Installer Script
; Creates a user-friendly installer for SPLICE Adobe Premiere Pro extension
;
; Requires: NSIS 3.x with MUI2 plugin
; Build: makensis splice-installer.nsi

;--------------------------------
; Includes

!include "MUI2.nsh"
!include "FileFunc.nsh"
!include "LogicLib.nsh"
!include "WinVer.nsh"
!include "x64.nsh"

;--------------------------------
; Configuration

!define PRODUCT_NAME "SPLICE"
!define PRODUCT_VERSION "6.0.3"
!define PRODUCT_PUBLISHER "SPLICE"
!define PRODUCT_WEB_SITE "https://spliceclips.com"
!define PRODUCT_SUPPORT_URL "https://docs.spliceclips.com"
!define PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY "Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\${PRODUCT_NAME}"
!define PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY "HKLM"

!define BUNDLE_ID "com.splice.panel"

; CEP Extension path
!define CEP_EXTENSIONS_PATH "$COMMONFILES\Adobe\CEP\extensions"
!define CEP_EXTENSIONS_PATH_X86 "$COMMONFILES32\Adobe\CEP\extensions"

; UPIA path for UXP installation
!define UPIA_PATH "$COMMONFILES\Adobe\Adobe Desktop Common\RemoteComponents\UPI\UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent\UnifiedPluginInstallerAgent.exe"

;--------------------------------
; General Settings

Name "${PRODUCT_NAME} ${PRODUCT_VERSION}"
OutFile "..\..\dist\SPLICE-Installer-${PRODUCT_VERSION}.exe"
InstallDir "$PROGRAMFILES\${PRODUCT_NAME}"
InstallDirRegKey HKLM "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "InstallLocation"
RequestExecutionLevel admin
ShowInstDetails show
ShowUnInstDetails show
BrandingText "${PRODUCT_NAME} v${PRODUCT_VERSION}"

; Compression
SetCompressor /SOLID lzma
SetCompressorDictSize 64

;--------------------------------
; Version Info

VIProductVersion "${PRODUCT_VERSION}.0"
VIAddVersionKey "ProductName" "${PRODUCT_NAME}"
VIAddVersionKey "CompanyName" "${PRODUCT_PUBLISHER}"
VIAddVersionKey "LegalCopyright" "Copyright  2024 ${PRODUCT_PUBLISHER}"
VIAddVersionKey "FileDescription" "${PRODUCT_NAME} Installer"
VIAddVersionKey "FileVersion" "${PRODUCT_VERSION}"
VIAddVersionKey "ProductVersion" "${PRODUCT_VERSION}"

;--------------------------------
; Interface Settings

!define MUI_ABORTWARNING
!define MUI_ICON "..\shared\assets\installer-icon.ico"
!define MUI_UNICON "..\shared\assets\uninstaller-icon.ico"
; Note: Custom bitmaps removed for cross-platform build compatibility
; To use custom graphics, create 164x314 pixel BMP for sidebar and 150x57 for header
; !define MUI_WELCOMEFINISHPAGE_BITMAP "..\shared\assets\installer-sidebar.bmp"
; !define MUI_HEADERIMAGE
; !define MUI_HEADERIMAGE_BITMAP "..\shared\assets\installer-header.bmp"
; !define MUI_HEADERIMAGE_RIGHT

;--------------------------------
; Pages

; Installer pages
!insertmacro MUI_PAGE_WELCOME
!insertmacro MUI_PAGE_LICENSE "..\shared\assets\license.txt"
!insertmacro MUI_PAGE_DIRECTORY
!insertmacro MUI_PAGE_INSTFILES
!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_NOAUTOCLOSE
!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_SHOWREADME ""
!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_SHOWREADME_NOTCHECKED
!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_SHOWREADME_TEXT "Open SPLICE documentation"
!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_SHOWREADME_FUNCTION OpenDocumentation
!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_LINK "Visit spliceclips.com"
!define MUI_FINISHPAGE_LINK_LOCATION "${PRODUCT_WEB_SITE}"
!insertmacro MUI_PAGE_FINISH

; Uninstaller pages
!insertmacro MUI_UNPAGE_CONFIRM
!insertmacro MUI_UNPAGE_INSTFILES

;--------------------------------
; Languages

!insertmacro MUI_LANGUAGE "English"

;--------------------------------
; Functions

Function .onInit
    ; Check if running on Windows 10 or later
    ${IfNot} ${AtLeastWin10}
        MessageBox MB_OK|MB_ICONSTOP "SPLICE requires Windows 10 or later."
        Abort
    ${EndIf}
    
    ; Check if Premiere Pro is running
    FindWindow $0 "" "Adobe Premiere Pro"
    ${If} $0 != 0
        MessageBox MB_YESNO|MB_ICONEXCLAMATION \
            "Adobe Premiere Pro is running.$\n$\nPlease close it before continuing.$\n$\nClose Premiere Pro now?" \
            IDYES close_premiere
        Abort
        
        close_premiere:
            ; Try to close Premiere Pro gracefully
            SendMessage $0 ${WM_CLOSE} 0 0
            Sleep 3000
            
            ; Check again
            FindWindow $0 "" "Adobe Premiere Pro"
            ${If} $0 != 0
                MessageBox MB_OK|MB_ICONSTOP "Premiere Pro is still running. Please close it manually and run the installer again."
                Abort
            ${EndIf}
    ${EndIf}
    
    ; Check for previous installation
    ReadRegStr $0 ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "UninstallString"
    ${If} $0 != ""
        MessageBox MB_YESNO|MB_ICONQUESTION \
            "A previous version of ${PRODUCT_NAME} is installed.$\n$\nWould you like to uninstall it first?" \
            IDNO skip_uninstall
        
        ExecWait '"$0" /S'
        
        skip_uninstall:
    ${EndIf}
FunctionEnd

Function OpenDocumentation
    ExecShell "open" "${PRODUCT_SUPPORT_URL}"
FunctionEnd

;--------------------------------
; Installer Sections

Section "SPLICE CEP Extension" SEC_CEP
    SectionIn RO  ; Required section
    
    SetOutPath "$INSTDIR"
    
    ; Create installation directory
    CreateDirectory "$INSTDIR"
    
    ; Determine CEP path based on system architecture
    ${If} ${RunningX64}
        StrCpy $1 "${CEP_EXTENSIONS_PATH}"
    ${Else}
        StrCpy $1 "${CEP_EXTENSIONS_PATH_X86}"
    ${EndIf}
    
    ; Create CEP extensions directory if it doesn't exist
    CreateDirectory "$1"
    CreateDirectory "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
    
    ; Remove old installation if exists
    RMDir /r "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
    CreateDirectory "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
    
    ; Copy CEP extension files
    SetOutPath "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
    File /r "..\..\splice-cep\CSXS"
    File /r "..\..\splice-cep\jsx"
    File /r "..\..\splice-cep\panel"
    
    ; Copy optional files if they exist
    SetOutPath "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
    File /nonfatal "..\..\splice-cep\.debug"
    File /nonfatal "..\..\splice-cep\mimetype"
    
    ; Store CEP installation path
    WriteRegStr ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "CEPPath" "$1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
    
    DetailPrint "CEP extension installed to: $1\${BUNDLE_ID}"
SectionEnd

Section "SPLICE UXP Plugin" SEC_UXP
    ; Check if CCX file exists
    IfFileExists "..\shared\splice-uxp.ccx" 0 skip_uxp
    
    ; Copy CCX to temp
    SetOutPath "$TEMP"
    File "..\shared\splice-uxp.ccx"
    
    ; Check if UPIA exists
    IfFileExists "${UPIA_PATH}" 0 fallback_uxp
    
    ; Install via UPIA
    DetailPrint "Installing UXP plugin via Adobe installer..."
    nsExec::ExecToLog '"${UPIA_PATH}" --install "$TEMP\splice-uxp.ccx"'
    Pop $0
    
    ${If} $0 == 0
        DetailPrint "UXP plugin installed successfully"
    ${Else}
        DetailPrint "UXP installation returned: $0"
        Goto fallback_uxp
    ${EndIf}
    
    ; Clean up temp file
    Delete "$TEMP\splice-uxp.ccx"
    Goto done_uxp
    
    fallback_uxp:
        DetailPrint "UPIA not found or failed. Copying CCX for manual installation..."
        
        ; Copy to user's Documents for manual installation
        CreateDirectory "$DOCUMENTS\SPLICE"
        CopyFiles "$TEMP\splice-uxp.ccx" "$DOCUMENTS\SPLICE\SPLICE-Plugin.ccx"
        
        MessageBox MB_OK|MB_ICONINFORMATION \
            "The UXP plugin could not be installed automatically.$\n$\n\
            A copy has been saved to:$\n$DOCUMENTS\SPLICE\SPLICE-Plugin.ccx$\n$\n\
            To install manually, double-click the .ccx file or install via Creative Cloud Desktop."
    
    skip_uxp:
    done_uxp:
SectionEnd

Section "Create Shortcuts" SEC_SHORTCUTS
    ; Create Start Menu folder
    CreateDirectory "$SMPROGRAMS\${PRODUCT_NAME}"
    
    ; Create shortcuts
    CreateShortCut "$SMPROGRAMS\${PRODUCT_NAME}\Uninstall ${PRODUCT_NAME}.lnk" "$INSTDIR\uninstall.exe"
    CreateShortCut "$SMPROGRAMS\${PRODUCT_NAME}\${PRODUCT_NAME} Documentation.lnk" "${PRODUCT_SUPPORT_URL}"
    CreateShortCut "$SMPROGRAMS\${PRODUCT_NAME}\${PRODUCT_NAME} Website.lnk" "${PRODUCT_WEB_SITE}"
SectionEnd

Section "-WriteUninstaller"
    ; Write uninstaller
    WriteUninstaller "$INSTDIR\uninstall.exe"
    
    ; Write registry keys for Add/Remove Programs
    WriteRegStr ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "DisplayName" "${PRODUCT_NAME}"
    WriteRegStr ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "DisplayVersion" "${PRODUCT_VERSION}"
    WriteRegStr ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "Publisher" "${PRODUCT_PUBLISHER}"
    WriteRegStr ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "URLInfoAbout" "${PRODUCT_WEB_SITE}"
    WriteRegStr ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "URLUpdateInfo" "${PRODUCT_WEB_SITE}"
    WriteRegStr ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "HelpLink" "${PRODUCT_SUPPORT_URL}"
    WriteRegStr ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "UninstallString" "$INSTDIR\uninstall.exe"
    WriteRegStr ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "InstallLocation" "$INSTDIR"
    WriteRegDWORD ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "NoModify" 1
    WriteRegDWORD ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "NoRepair" 1
    
    ; Calculate installed size
    ${GetSize} "$INSTDIR" "/S=0K" $0 $1 $2
    IntFmt $0 "0x%08X" $0
    WriteRegDWORD ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "EstimatedSize" "$0"
SectionEnd

;--------------------------------
; Section Descriptions

!insertmacro MUI_FUNCTION_DESCRIPTION_BEGIN
    !insertmacro MUI_DESCRIPTION_TEXT ${SEC_CEP} "SPLICE extension for Premiere Pro 14.0 - 24.x (Required)"
    !insertmacro MUI_DESCRIPTION_TEXT ${SEC_UXP} "SPLICE plugin for Premiere Pro 25.0+ (Recommended)"
    !insertmacro MUI_DESCRIPTION_TEXT ${SEC_SHORTCUTS} "Create Start Menu shortcuts"
!insertmacro MUI_FUNCTION_DESCRIPTION_END

;--------------------------------
; Uninstaller Section

Section "Uninstall"
    ; Check if Premiere Pro is running
    FindWindow $0 "" "Adobe Premiere Pro"
    ${If} $0 != 0
        MessageBox MB_OK|MB_ICONSTOP "Please close Adobe Premiere Pro before uninstalling."
        Abort
    ${EndIf}
    
    ; Read CEP installation path
    ReadRegStr $1 ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}" "CEPPath"
    
    ; Remove CEP extension
    ${If} $1 != ""
        RMDir /r "$1"
        DetailPrint "Removed CEP extension from: $1"
    ${Else}
        ; Fallback to default paths
        RMDir /r "${CEP_EXTENSIONS_PATH}\${BUNDLE_ID}"
        RMDir /r "${CEP_EXTENSIONS_PATH_X86}\${BUNDLE_ID}"
    ${EndIf}
    
    ; Try to uninstall UXP via UPIA
    IfFileExists "${UPIA_PATH}" 0 skip_uxp_uninstall
    
    DetailPrint "Attempting to uninstall UXP plugin..."
    nsExec::ExecToLog '"${UPIA_PATH}" --uninstall "${BUNDLE_ID}"'
    
    skip_uxp_uninstall:
    
    ; Remove Start Menu shortcuts
    RMDir /r "$SMPROGRAMS\${PRODUCT_NAME}"
    
    ; Remove installation directory
    RMDir /r "$INSTDIR"
    
    ; Remove registry keys
    DeleteRegKey ${PRODUCT_UNINST_ROOT_KEY} "${PRODUCT_UNINST_KEY}"
    
    DetailPrint "Uninstallation complete"
SectionEnd

;--------------------------------
; Callbacks

Function un.onInit
    MessageBox MB_YESNO|MB_ICONQUESTION \
        "Are you sure you want to uninstall ${PRODUCT_NAME}?" \
        IDYES +2
    Abort
FunctionEnd

Function un.onUninstSuccess
    MessageBox MB_OK|MB_ICONINFORMATION \
        "${PRODUCT_NAME} has been successfully uninstalled."
FunctionEnd

1# Apple Developer ID Signing Guide for SPLICE
     2
     3This guide explains how to set up Apple Developer ID signing for SPLICE installers so that macOS users can install without Gatekeeper warnings.
     4
     5## Why You Need This
     6
     7Without Apple Developer ID signing:
     8- Users see "Apple could not verify this app is free of malware"
     9- Users must go to System Preferences  Security  "Open Anyway"
    10- Professional software should not require this workaround
    11
    12With Apple Developer ID signing:
    13- Double-click to install works seamlessly
    14- No security warnings
    15- Professional, polished user experience
    16
    17## Prerequisites
    18
    191. **Apple Developer Program Membership** ($99/year)
    20   - Enroll at: https://developer.apple.com/programs/enroll/
    21   - Approval typically takes 24-48 hours
    22
    232. **macOS with Xcode Command Line Tools**
    24   ```bash
    25   xcode-select --install
    26   ```
    27
    283. **The SPLICE build system** (already set up)
    29
    30## Step 1: Create Developer ID Installer Certificate
    31
    32### Option A: Using Xcode
    33
    341. Open Xcode  Preferences  Accounts
    352. Select your Apple ID  Manage Certificates
    363. Click +  Developer ID Installer
    374. Certificate is automatically installed in Keychain
    38
    39### Option B: Using developer.apple.com
    40
    411. Go to https://developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates
    422. Click the + button to create a new certificate
    433. Select **Developer ID Installer**
    444. Follow the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) instructions:
    45   - Open Keychain Access  Certificate Assistant  Request a Certificate from a Certificate Authority
    46   - Enter your email, select "Saved to disk"
    47   - Upload the CSR file
    485. Download the certificate and double-click to install in Keychain
    49
    50### Verify Certificate Installation
    51
    52```bash
    53security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer"
    54```
    55
    56You should see something like:
    57```
    581) ABC123... "Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAMID)"
    59```
    60
    61## Step 2: Create App-Specific Password
    62
    63Notarization requires an app-specific password (not your regular Apple ID password):
    64
    651. Go to https://appleid.apple.com
    662. Sign in with your Apple ID
    673. Navigate to **Security**  **App-Specific Passwords**
    684. Click **Generate** (or +)
    695. Name it: `SPLICE Notarization`
    706. **Save the password** (format: `xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx`)
    71
    72 You can only see this password once! Store it securely.
    73
    74## Step 3: Find Your Team ID
    75
    761. Go to https://developer.apple.com/account
    772. Click **Membership** in the sidebar
    783. Find your **Team ID** (10-character alphanumeric code)
    79
    80## Step 4: Configure Environment Variables
    81
    82### Option A: Use the Setup Script (Recommended)
    83
    84```bash
    85cd /Users/imorgado/SPLICE
    86chmod +x build/scripts/setup-apple-signing.sh
    87./build/scripts/setup-apple-signing.sh
    88```
    89
    90This creates `.env.apple-signing` with your credentials.
    91
    92### Option B: Manual Configuration
    93
    94Create a file at `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/.env.apple-signing`:
    95
    96```bash
    97# Apple Developer Signing Configuration
    98export APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID="Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAMID)"
    99export APPLE_ID="your.email@example.com"
   100export APPLE_TEAM_ID="ABCD1234XY"
   101export APPLE_APP_PASSWORD="xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"
   102```
   103
   104Protect the file:
   105```bash
   106chmod 600 .env.apple-signing
   107```
   108
   109Add to `.gitignore`:
   110```bash
   111echo ".env.apple-signing" >> .gitignore
   112```
   113
   114## Step 5: Build Signed Installers
   115
   116```bash
   117cd /Users/imorgado/SPLICE
   118
   119# Load credentials
   120source .env.apple-signing
   121
   122# Build all installers (CEP + UXP, macOS + Windows)
   123./build/scripts/build-all.sh
   124```
   125
   126The build process will:
   1271.  Build the installer package
   1282.  Sign with Developer ID Installer certificate
   1293.  Submit to Apple for notarization
   1304.  Wait for notarization approval (usually 1-5 minutes)
   1315.  Staple the notarization ticket to the package
   132
   133## Step 6: Verify Signed Package
   134
   135```bash
   136# Check code signature
   137codesign -dv --verbose=4 build/output/SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg
   138
   139# Verify notarization
   140spctl -a -v build/output/SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg
   141
   142# Check stapled ticket
   143xcrun stapler validate build/output/SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg
   144```
   145
   146Expected output:
   147```
   148build/output/SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg: accepted
   149source=Notarized Developer ID
   150```
   151
   152## Troubleshooting
   153
   154### "No identity found"
   155Your certificate isn't in Keychain. Re-download from developer.apple.com and double-click to install.
   156
   157### "The software is not signed"
   158Environment variables aren't loaded. Run `source .env.apple-signing` before building.
   159
   160### "Unable to upload to notarization service"
   161- Check internet connection
   162- Verify APPLE_APP_PASSWORD is correct
   163- Ensure APPLE_ID and APPLE_TEAM_ID match
   164
   165### "Notarization failed"
   166Check the detailed log:
   167```bash
   168xcrun notarytool log <submission-id> \
   169  --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
   170  --team-id "$APPLE_TEAM_ID" \
   171  --password "$APPLE_APP_PASSWORD"
   172```
   173
   174### Certificate Expired
   175Certificates expire after 5 years. Create a new one at developer.apple.com.
   176
   177## Security Best Practices
   178
   1791. **Never commit `.env.apple-signing`** to git (it's in .gitignore)
   1802. **Protect the file**: `chmod 600 .env.apple-signing`
   1813. **Use app-specific password**, not your main Apple ID password
   1824. **Revoke old app-specific passwords** if compromised
   183
   184## Build Script Reference
   185
   186| Script | Purpose |
   187|--------|---------|
   188| `build/scripts/setup-apple-signing.sh` | Interactive setup for credentials |
   189| `build/scripts/build-all.sh` | Build all installers |
   190| `build/scripts/build-macos.sh` | Build CEP macOS installer |
   191| `build/scripts/build-uxp-macos.sh` | Build UXP macOS installer |
   192| `build/scripts/build-windows.sh` | Build Windows installers |
   193
   194## Quick Reference
   195
   196```bash
   197# One-time setup
   198./build/scripts/setup-apple-signing.sh
   199
   200# Before each build session
   201source .env.apple-signing
   202
   203# Build signed installers
   204./build/scripts/build-all.sh
   205
   206# Verify signature
   207spctl -a -v build/output/SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg
   208```
   209
   210## Cost Summary
   211
   212| Item | Cost |
   213|------|------|
   214| Apple Developer Program | $99/year |
   215| Certificate creation | Included |
   216| Notarization | Included |
   217| **Total** | **$99/year** |
   218
   219## Timeline
   220
   221- Apple Developer Program enrollment: 24-48 hours
   222- Certificate creation: Instant
   223- Notarization per build: 1-5 minutes
   224

</system-reminder>

   ```

3. **The SPLICE build system** (already set up)

## Step 1: Create Developer ID Installer Certificate

### Option A: Using Xcode

1. Open Xcode  Preferences  Accounts
2. Select your Apple ID  Manage Certificates
3. Click +  Developer ID Installer
4. Certificate is automatically installed in Keychain

### Option B: Using developer.apple.com

1. Go to https://developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates
2. Click the + button to create a new certificate
3. Select **Developer ID Installer**
4. Follow the Certificate Signing Request (CSR) instructions:
   - Open Keychain Access  Certificate Assistant  Request a Certificate from a Certificate Authority
   - Enter your email, select "Saved to disk"
   - Upload the CSR file
5. Download the certificate and double-click to install in Keychain

### Verify Certificate Installation

```bash
security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer"
```

You should see something like:
```
1) ABC123... "Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAMID)"
```

## Step 2: Create App-Specific Password

Notarization requires an app-specific password (not your regular Apple ID password):

1. Go to https://appleid.apple.com
2. Sign in with your Apple ID
3. Navigate to **Security**  **App-Specific Passwords**
4. Click **Generate** (or +)
5. Name it: `SPLICE Notarization`
6. **Save the password** (format: `xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx`)

 You can only see this password once! Store it securely.

## Step 3: Find Your Team ID

1. Go to https://developer.apple.com/account
2. Click **Membership** in the sidebar
3. Find your **Team ID** (10-character alphanumeric code)

## Step 4: Configure Environment Variables

### Option A: Use the Setup Script (Recommended)

```bash
cd /Users/imorgado/SPLICE
chmod +x build/scripts/setup-apple-signing.sh
./build/scripts/setup-apple-signing.sh
```

This creates `.env.apple-signing` with your credentials.

### Option B: Manual Configuration

Create a file at `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/.env.apple-signing`:

```bash
# Apple Developer Signing Configuration
export APPLE_DEVELOPER_ID="Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAMID)"
export APPLE_ID="your.email@example.com"
export APPLE_TEAM_ID="ABCD1234XY"
export APPLE_APP_PASSWORD="xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"
```

Protect the file:
```bash
chmod 600 .env.apple-signing
```

Add to `.gitignore`:
```bash
echo ".env.apple-signing" >> .gitignore
```

## Step 5: Build Signed Installers

```bash
cd /Users/imorgado/SPLICE

# Load credentials
source .env.apple-signing

# Build all installers (CEP + UXP, macOS + Windows)
./build/scripts/build-all.sh
```

The build process will:
1.  Build the installer package
2.  Sign with Developer ID Installer certificate
3.  Submit to Apple for notarization
4.  Wait for notarization approval (usually 1-5 minutes)
5.  Staple the notarization ticket to the package

## Step 6: Verify Signed Package

```bash
# Check code signature
codesign -dv --verbose=4 build/output/SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg

# Verify notarization
spctl -a -v build/output/SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg

# Check stapled ticket
xcrun stapler validate build/output/SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg
```

Expected output:
```
build/output/SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg: accepted
source=Notarized Developer ID
```

## Troubleshooting

### "No identity found"
Your certificate isn't in Keychain. Re-download from developer.apple.com and double-click to install.

### "The software is not signed"
Environment variables aren't loaded. Run `source .env.apple-signing` before building.

### "Unable to upload to notarization service"
- Check internet connection
- Verify APPLE_APP_PASSWORD is correct
- Ensure APPLE_ID and APPLE_TEAM_ID match

### "Notarization failed"
Check the detailed log:
```bash
xcrun notarytool log <submission-id> \
  --apple-id "$APPLE_ID" \
  --team-id "$APPLE_TEAM_ID" \
  --password "$APPLE_APP_PASSWORD"
```

### Certificate Expired
Certificates expire after 5 years. Create a new one at developer.apple.com.

## Security Best Practices

1. **Never commit `.env.apple-signing`** to git (it's in .gitignore)
2. **Protect the file**: `chmod 600 .env.apple-signing`
3. **Use app-specific password**, not your main Apple ID password
4. **Revoke old app-specific passwords** if compromised

## Build Script Reference

| Script | Purpose |
|--------|---------|
| `build/scripts/setup-apple-signing.sh` | Interactive setup for credentials |
| `build/scripts/build-all.sh` | Build all installers |
| `build/scripts/build-macos.sh` | Build CEP macOS installer |
| `build/scripts/build-uxp-macos.sh` | Build UXP macOS installer |
| `build/scripts/build-windows.sh` | Build Windows installers |

## Quick Reference

```bash
# One-time setup
./build/scripts/setup-apple-signing.sh

# Before each build session
source .env.apple-signing

# Build signed installers
./build/scripts/build-all.sh

# Verify signature
spctl -a -v build/output/SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg
```

| Apple Developer Program | $99/year |
| Certificate creation | Included |
| Notarization | Included |
| **Total** | **$99/year** |

## Timeline

- Apple Developer Program enrollment: 24-48 hours
- Certificate creation: Instant
- Notarization per build: 1-5 minutes

#

#   --unsigned: Skip code signing (for development builds)
#

# Note: This script can be run on macOS/Linux if NSIS is installed

#

set -e

# Get script directory and project root
SCRIPT_DIR="$(cd "$(dirname "${BASH_SOURCE[0]}")" && pwd)"
PROJECT_ROOT="$(cd "$SCRIPT_DIR/../.." && pwd)"
BUILD_DIR="$PROJECT_ROOT/build"
OUTPUT_DIR="$BUILD_DIR/output"
INSTALLERS_DIR="$BUILD_DIR/installers/windows"
CEP_SOURCE="$PROJECT_ROOT/splice-cep"
MANIFEST_FILE="$CEP_SOURCE/CSXS/manifest.xml"

# Build directories
STAGING_DIR="$BUILD_DIR/.staging-win"

# NSIS script
NSIS_SCRIPT="$INSTALLERS_DIR/splice-installer.nsi"

# Colors for output
RED='\033[0;31m'
GREEN='\033[0;32m'
YELLOW='\033[1;33m'
BLUE='\033[0;34m'
NC='\033[0m' # No Color

# Print functions
print_info() {
    echo -e "${BLUE}[INFO]${NC} $1"
}

print_success() {
    echo -e "${GREEN}[SUCCESS]${NC} $1"
}

print_warning() {
    echo -e "${YELLOW}[WARNING]${NC} $1"
}

print_error() {
    echo -e "${RED}[ERROR]${NC} $1"
}

# Extract version from manifest.xml
get_version() {
    if [[ -f "$MANIFEST_FILE" ]]; then
        VERSION=$(grep -o 'ExtensionBundleVersion="[^"]*"' "$MANIFEST_FILE" | cut -d'"' -f2)
        if [[ -z "$VERSION" ]]; then
            print_warning "Could not extract version from manifest.xml, using default"
            VERSION="1.0.0"
        fi
    else
        print_warning "manifest.xml not found, using default version"
        VERSION="1.0.0"
    fi
    echo "$VERSION"
}

# Check prerequisites
check_prerequisites() {
    print_info "Checking prerequisites..."
    
    # Check for NSIS

    if command -v makensis &> /dev/null; then
        nsis_cmd="makensis"
    elif command -v /usr/local/bin/makensis &> /dev/null; then
        nsis_cmd="/usr/local/bin/makensis"
    elif [[ -f "/cygdrive/c/Program Files (x86)/NSIS/makensis.exe" ]]; then
        nsis_cmd="/cygdrive/c/Program Files (x86)/NSIS/makensis.exe"
    elif [[ -f "/c/Program Files (x86)/NSIS/makensis.exe" ]]; then
        nsis_cmd="/c/Program Files (x86)/NSIS/makensis.exe"

    if [[ -z "$nsis_cmd" ]]; then
        print_error "NSIS (makensis) not found"

        echo "Please install NSIS:"
        echo "  - macOS: brew install nsis"
        echo "  - Linux: sudo apt-get install nsis"
        echo "  - Windows: Download from https://nsis.sourceforge.io/Download"
        exit 1
    fi

# SPLICE Installer Build Guide

This document provides complete instructions for building the SPLICE installers for macOS and Windows.

## Overview

The SPLICE installer system creates native platform installers that provide a FireCut-style one-click installation experience:

- **macOS**: Native `.pkg` installer built with `pkgbuild` and `productbuild`
- **Windows**: `.exe` installer built with NSIS (Nullsoft Scriptable Install System)
- **UXP Plugin**: `.ccx` package for Premiere Pro 25.0+

## Directory Structure

```
installer/
 .github/
    workflows/
        build-installers.yml    # GitHub Actions CI/CD

    build-pkg.sh                # macOS build script
    distribution.xml            # productbuild configuration
    uninstall.sh               # Uninstaller script
    resources/                  # Installer UI HTML files
       welcome.html

    scripts/
        preinstall              # Pre-installation script
        postinstall             # Post-installation script
 windows/
    splice-installer.nsi        # NSIS installer script
    build-exe.bat               # Windows build script
 scripts/
    build-ccx.sh               # CCX packager (Unix)
    build-ccx.bat              # CCX packager (Windows)
 shared/
    version.json               # Version configuration
    assets/
        license.txt            # EULA
        installer-icon.ico     # Windows installer icon
        ...                    # Other assets
 package.json                   # Node.js dependencies
 BUILD.md                       # This file
```

## Prerequisites

### macOS Build Requirements

- macOS 10.14 or later
- Xcode Command Line Tools (`xcode-select --install`)
- For signing: Apple Developer ID Installer certificate
- For notarization: Apple Developer account with App-Specific Password

### Windows Build Requirements

- Windows 10 or later
- [NSIS 3.x](https://nsis.sourceforge.io/Download) (add to PATH)
- For signing: Code signing certificate (.pfx file)
- Optional: [Windows SDK](https://developer.microsoft.com/windows/downloads/windows-sdk/) for `signtool`

### Cross-Platform Requirements

- Node.js 18+ and npm
- Git
- zip utility (included on macOS, use PowerShell on Windows)

## Building the Installers

### Quick Start (Local Build)

```bash
# Install dependencies
cd installer
npm install

# Build macOS installer (on macOS)
./macos/build-pkg.sh

# Build Windows installer (on Windows)
windows\build-exe.bat
```

### Building the CCX Package

The CCX package is required for UXP plugin support (Premiere Pro 25+):

```bash
# On macOS/Linux
./scripts/build-ccx.sh

# On Windows
scripts\build-ccx.bat
```

The CCX file will be created at `shared/splice-uxp.ccx`.

### Building macOS Installer (Unsigned)

```bash
cd installer
./macos/build-pkg.sh
```

Output: `dist/SPLICE-Installer-{version}.pkg`

### Building macOS Installer (Signed + Notarized)

```bash
./macos/build-pkg.sh \
  --sign "Developer ID Installer: Your Company (TEAM_ID)" \
  --notarize \
  --apple-id "your@email.com" \
  --team-id "TEAM_ID" \
  --password "app-specific-password"
```

Or using environment variables:

```bash
export SIGNING_IDENTITY="Developer ID Installer: Your Company (TEAM_ID)"
export NOTARIZE=true
export APPLE_ID="your@email.com"
export TEAM_ID="TEAM_ID"
export APP_PASSWORD="app-specific-password"

./macos/build-pkg.sh
```

### Building Windows Installer (Unsigned)

```cmd
cd installer\windows
build-exe.bat
```

Output: `dist\SPLICE-Installer-{version}.exe`

### Building Windows Installer (Signed)

```cmd
set CODE_SIGN_CERT=path\to\certificate.pfx
set CODE_SIGN_PASSWORD=your-certificate-password

build-exe.bat
```

## Code Signing

### macOS Code Signing Requirements

For complete step-by-step instructions, see: [`installer/macos/create-app-specific-password.md`](macos/create-app-specific-password.md)

#### Quick Start

1. **Apple Developer Program membership** ($99/year)

2. **Check for existing Developer ID Installer certificate**:
   ```bash
   security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer"
   ```

3. **If no certificate exists, create one**:
   
   a. Open **Keychain Access**  Certificate Assistant  Request a Certificate From a Certificate Authority
   
   b. Save the CSR file to disk
   
   c. Go to [developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates](https://developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates)
   
   d. Click "+"  Select **"Developer ID Installer"** (NOT Developer ID Application!)
   
   e. Upload the CSR file  Download the certificate  Double-click to install

4. **Create App-Specific Password** (for notarization):
   - Go to [appleid.apple.com](https://appleid.apple.com)
   - Sign In & Security  App-Specific Passwords
   - Generate a new password for "SPLICE Notarization"
   - Store in keychain: `xcrun notarytool store-credentials "AC_PASSWORD" --apple-id "your@email.com" --team-id "TEAM_ID" --password "xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"`

5. **Find your Team ID**:
   ```bash
   security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer"
   # Team ID is the letters/numbers in parentheses at the end
   ```

### Signing and Notarizing the PKG

Use the dedicated signing script:

```bash
# Sign only (no notarization)
./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh --no-notarize dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg

# Sign and notarize (using stored keychain credentials)
./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh \
    --apple-id "your@email.com" \
    --team-id "TEAM_ID" \
    --password "@keychain:AC_PASSWORD" \
    dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg

# Sign and notarize (using environment variables)
export APPLE_ID="your@email.com"
export TEAM_ID="TEAM_ID"
export APP_PASSWORD="xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"
./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
```

The script will:
1. Auto-detect your Developer ID Installer certificate
2. Sign the PKG with `productsign`
3. Submit to Apple's notary service
4. Wait for notarization to complete
5. Staple the notarization ticket to the PKG
6. Verify the final package

Output: `dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg`

### Verifying the Signed Package

```bash
# Check signature
pkgutil --check-signature dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg

# Check Gatekeeper assessment
spctl --assess -vv --type install dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg

# Verify notarization staple
xcrun stapler validate dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg
```

### macOS Notarization Process

Notarization is required for Gatekeeper approval on macOS 10.15+:

1. Package is uploaded to Apple's notary service
2. Apple scans for malware and validates signing
3. Notarization ticket is stapled to the package
4. Users can install without security warnings

The sign-and-notarize.sh script handles this automatically.

### Windows Code Signing Requirements

1. **Code Signing Certificate** from a trusted CA:
   - [DigiCert](https://www.digicert.com/signing/code-signing-certificates)
   - [Sectigo](https://sectigo.com/ssl-certificates-tls/code-signing)
   - [GlobalSign](https://www.globalsign.com/en/code-signing-certificate)
   
   Prices range from ~$200-500/year.

2. **Extended Validation (EV) Certificate** (recommended):
   - Provides immediate SmartScreen reputation
   - Requires hardware token (USB key)
   - Higher cost but better user experience

3. **Standard Certificate**:
   - Lower cost
   - Requires building reputation with SmartScreen
   - Initial users may see warnings

### Using signtool (Windows SDK)

```cmd
signtool sign /f certificate.pfx /p password /t http://timestamp.digicert.com /d "SPLICE Installer" SPLICE-Installer.exe
```

### Using osslsigncode (Cross-Platform)

```bash
osslsigncode sign -pkcs12 certificate.pfx -pass password -n "SPLICE Installer" -t http://timestamp.digicert.com -in unsigned.exe -out signed.exe
```

## Version Management

Version is centralized in `shared/version.json`:

```json
{
  "version": "6.0.3",
  "bundleId": "com.splice.panel"
}
```

To update the version:

1. Edit `shared/version.json`
2. Update `splice-cep/CSXS/manifest.xml`
3. Update `splice-plugin/manifest.json`
4. Rebuild installers

Or use the sync script:

```bash
npm run sync-version
```

## CI/CD with GitHub Actions

### Setting Up Secrets

Add these secrets to your GitHub repository:

**macOS Signing:**
- `MACOS_CERTIFICATE`: Base64-encoded .p12 certificate
- `MACOS_CERTIFICATE_PWD`: Certificate password
- `MACOS_SIGNING_IDENTITY`: Full certificate name
- `KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD`: Random password for temp keychain
- `APPLE_ID`: Apple ID email
- `APPLE_TEAM_ID`: Apple Developer Team ID
- `APPLE_APP_PASSWORD`: App-specific password

**Windows Signing:**
- `WINDOWS_CERTIFICATE`: Base64-encoded .pfx certificate
- `WINDOWS_CERTIFICATE_PWD`: Certificate password

### Encoding Certificates for Secrets

```bash
# macOS
base64 -i certificate.p12 -o certificate-base64.txt

# Windows (PowerShell)
[Convert]::ToBase64String([IO.File]::ReadAllBytes("certificate.pfx")) | Out-File certificate-base64.txt
```

### Triggering Builds

- **Automatic**: Push a tag like `v6.0.3`
- **Manual**: Use GitHub Actions "Run workflow" button
- **PR builds**: Automatically builds on pull requests (unsigned)

### Release Process

1. Update version in `shared/version.json`
2. Commit changes
3. Create and push tag:
   ```bash
   git tag v6.0.3
   git push origin v6.0.3
   ```
4. GitHub Actions builds signed installers
5. Draft release is created with artifacts
6. Review and publish the release

## Testing

### Local Testing

**macOS:**
```bash
# Test installation
sudo installer -pkg dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg -target /

# Verify installation
ls -la "/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel"
```

**Windows:**
```cmd
# Run installer
dist\SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.exe

# Verify installation
dir "C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Adobe\CEP\extensions\com.splice.panel"
```

### Testing Checklist

- [ ] Installer runs without errors
- [ ] CEP extension appears in Premiere Pro Extensions menu
- [ ] UXP plugin appears in Premiere Pro 25+ (if applicable)
- [ ] Uninstaller removes all files
- [ ] No leftover files or registry entries

## Troubleshooting

### macOS Issues

**"unidentified developer" warning:**
- The package is not signed or notarized
- Solution: Sign and notarize, or right-click  Open

**"damaged and can't be opened" error:**
- Quarantine attribute issue
- Solution: `xattr -cr SPLICE-Installer.pkg`

**Notarization fails:**
- Check Apple ID and app-specific password
- Ensure certificate is valid and not expired
- Check for hardened runtime issues

### Windows Issues

**SmartScreen warning:**
- The installer is not signed or lacks reputation
- Solution: Sign with EV certificate, or users click "More info"  "Run anyway"

**NSIS not found:**
- Install NSIS and add to PATH
- Or set `NSIS_PATH` environment variable

**Installation fails with UAC prompt:**
- Run as administrator
- Check antivirus isn't blocking

### General Issues

**CEP extension not showing:**
- Enable debug mode: 
  - macOS: `defaults write com.adobe.CSXS.11 PlayerDebugMode 1`
  - Windows: Add registry key `PlayerDebugMode = 1` under `HKCU\Software\Adobe\CSXS.11`
- Restart Premiere Pro

**UXP plugin not showing:**
- Verify Premiere Pro version is 25.0+
- Check Creative Cloud Desktop for plugin status
- Try manual CCX installation

## Support

For build issues, contact the development team or check the GitHub Issues page.

# macOS Code Signing Setup Guide

This guide walks you through setting up all the credentials needed to sign and notarize the SPLICE macOS installer.

## Overview

To distribute a signed and notarized PKG installer, you need:

1. **Developer ID Installer Certificate** - For signing the PKG
2. **Apple ID with App-Specific Password** - For notarization
3. **Team ID** - Your Apple Developer Team identifier

## Prerequisites

- Active [Apple Developer Program](https://developer.apple.com/programs/) membership ($99/year)
- macOS with Keychain Access
- Xcode Command Line Tools (`xcode-select --install`)

---

## Step 1: Create a Developer ID Installer Certificate

### 1.1 Check for Existing Certificates

First, check if you already have a Developer ID Installer certificate:

```bash
security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer"
```

If you see output like:
```
1) ABC123... "Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAMID)"
```

You already have the certificate! Skip to Step 2.

### 1.2 Create a Certificate Signing Request (CSR)

If no certificate exists, create one:

1. Open **Keychain Access** (Applications  Utilities  Keychain Access)

2. From the menu bar, select:
   **Keychain Access  Certificate Assistant  Request a Certificate From a Certificate Authority**

3. Fill in the form:
   - **User Email Address**: Your Apple Developer email (isaacfmor@gmail.com)
   - **Common Name**: Your name or company name
   - **CA Email Address**: Leave blank
   - **Request is**: Select **"Saved to disk"**

4. Click **Continue** and save the `.certSigningRequest` file to your Desktop

### 1.3 Create the Certificate in Apple Developer Portal

1. Go to [Apple Developer Certificates](https://developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates/list)

2. Sign in with your Apple ID

3. Click the **+** button to create a new certificate

4. Under "Software", select **"Developer ID Installer"**
   
   >  **IMPORTANT**: Select "Developer ID Installer", NOT "Developer ID Application"
   > 
   > - **Developer ID Application** - For signing .app bundles
   > - **Developer ID Installer** - For signing .pkg installers  This one!

5. Click **Continue**

6. Upload the CSR file you created in Step 1.2

7. Click **Continue**

8. **Download** the certificate (it will be named something like `developerID_installer.cer`)

### 1.4 Install the Certificate

1. Double-click the downloaded `.cer` file

2. Keychain Access will open and install the certificate

3. The certificate should appear in the "login" keychain under "My Certificates"

4. Verify installation:
   ```bash
   security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer"
   ```

   You should see:
   ```
   1) <HASH> "Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAM_ID)"
   ```

---

## Step 2: Create an App-Specific Password

App-specific passwords are required for notarization because Apple requires two-factor authentication, and regular passwords can't be used in scripts.

### 2.1 Generate the Password

1. Go to [appleid.apple.com](https://appleid.apple.com)

2. Sign in with your Apple ID (isaacfmor@gmail.com)

3. Navigate to **Sign-In and Security**  **App-Specific Passwords**

4. Click **Generate an app-specific password** (or the + button)

5. Enter a label: **"SPLICE Notarization"**

6. Click **Create**

7. **Copy the generated password** (format: `xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx`)

   >  **IMPORTANT**: Save this password securely! It will only be shown once.

### 2.2 Store the Password Securely (Recommended)

Instead of putting the password in scripts, store it in the macOS Keychain:

```bash
xcrun notarytool store-credentials "AC_PASSWORD" \
    --apple-id "isaacfmor@gmail.com" \
    --team-id "YOUR_TEAM_ID" \
    --password "xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"
```

Then reference it in the signing script with:
```bash
--password "@keychain:AC_PASSWORD"
```

---

## Step 3: Find Your Team ID

Your Team ID is displayed:

1. In the certificate name: `Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAM_ID)`

2. In the [Apple Developer Membership](https://developer.apple.com/account#MembershipDetailsCard) page

3. Via command line:
   ```bash
   security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID Installer" | sed 's/.*(\([A-Z0-9]*\)).*/\1/'
   ```

---

## Step 4: Test Your Setup

### 4.1 Verify Certificate

```bash
# List all Developer ID certificates
security find-identity -v -p basic | grep "Developer ID"

# Should show:
# "Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAM_ID)"
```

### 4.2 Test Signing (without notarization)

```bash
cd /Users/imorgado/Desktop/SPLICE/installer

# Sign the PKG (replace with your actual certificate name)
./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh \
    --no-notarize \
    dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
```

### 4.3 Test Full Signing + Notarization

```bash
# Using stored keychain credentials
./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh \
    --apple-id "isaacfmor@gmail.com" \
    --team-id "YOUR_TEAM_ID" \
    --password "@keychain:AC_PASSWORD" \
    dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg

# Or using environment variables
export APPLE_ID="isaacfmor@gmail.com"
export TEAM_ID="YOUR_TEAM_ID"
export APP_PASSWORD="xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"

./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
```

---

## Verification Commands

### Check PKG Signature

```bash
pkgutil --check-signature dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg
```

Expected output:
```
Package "SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg":
   Status: signed by a developer certificate issued by Apple for distribution
   Signed with a trusted timestamp on: 2026-01-07 01:20:00 +0000
   Certificate Chain:
    1. Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAM_ID)
       Expires: 2031-02-01 22:12:15 +0000
       SHA256 Fingerprint: ...
    2. Developer ID Certification Authority
       ...
    3. Apple Root CA
       ...
```

### Check Gatekeeper Assessment

```bash
spctl --assess -vv --type install dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg
```

Expected output:
```
dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg: accepted
source=Notarized Developer ID
```

### Check Notarization Status

```bash
xcrun stapler validate dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg
```

Expected output:
```
Processing: dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3-signed.pkg
The validate action worked!
```

---

## Troubleshooting

### "No Developer ID Installer certificate found"

1. Verify you created "Developer ID **Installer**" not "Developer ID Application"
2. Make sure you downloaded and double-clicked the certificate
3. Check it appears in Keychain Access under "My Certificates"

### "Unable to process... verify both Apple ID and app-specific password are correct"

1. Verify your Apple ID email is correct
2. Generate a new app-specific password
3. Make sure two-factor authentication is enabled on your Apple ID

### "Team ID is not associated with this Apple ID"

1. Your Team ID might be different from what you're using
2. Check your Team ID at developer.apple.com/account
3. If you have multiple teams, select the correct one

### "Certificate has been revoked"

1. Check the certificate status in Apple Developer Portal
2. If revoked, create a new Developer ID Installer certificate
3. Delete the old certificate from Keychain Access

### Notarization Takes Too Long

- Normal notarization takes 5-15 minutes
- If it takes longer, check Apple's [System Status](https://developer.apple.com/system-status/)
- The notary service can be slow during high-traffic periods

---

## Environment Variables Reference

For CI/CD or automated builds, set these environment variables:

```bash
# Required for signing
export SIGNING_IDENTITY="Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAM_ID)"

# Required for notarization
export APPLE_ID="your@email.com"
export TEAM_ID="YOUR_TEAM_ID"
export APP_PASSWORD="xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx"
```

Or use the signing script options:
```bash
./macos/sign-and-notarize.sh \
    --identity "Developer ID Installer: Your Name (TEAM_ID)" \
    --apple-id "your@email.com" \
    --team-id "YOUR_TEAM_ID" \
    --password "xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx" \
    dist/SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg
```

---

## Security Best Practices

1. **Never commit credentials** to version control
2. **Use keychain** for local development
3. **Use GitHub Secrets** for CI/CD
4. **Rotate app-specific passwords** periodically
5. **Keep certificates secure** - back up your Keychain

---

## Quick Reference

| Item | Where to Get |
|------|-------------|
| Developer ID Installer Certificate | [developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates](https://developer.apple.com/account/resources/certificates) |
| App-Specific Password | [appleid.apple.com](https://appleid.apple.com)  Sign-In and Security |
| Team ID | Certificate name or [developer.apple.com/account](https://developer.apple.com/account) |

name: Build Installers

on:
  push:
    tags:
      - 'v*'
    branches:
      - main
      - release/*
  pull_request:
    branches:
      - main
  workflow_dispatch:
    inputs:
      version:
        description: 'Version override (e.g., 6.0.4)'
        required: false
        default: ''
      sign_macos:
        description: 'Sign macOS installer'
        type: boolean
        default: false
      notarize_macos:
        description: 'Notarize macOS installer'
        type: boolean
        default: false
      sign_windows:
        description: 'Sign Windows installer'
        type: boolean
        default: false

env:
  NODE_VERSION: '20'

jobs:
  # Extract version from tag or use default
  version:
    name: Determine Version
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    outputs:
      version: ${{ steps.version.outputs.version }}
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Extract version
        id: version
        run: |
          if [ -n "${{ github.event.inputs.version }}" ]; then
            echo "version=${{ github.event.inputs.version }}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          elif [[ "${{ github.ref }}" == refs/tags/v* ]]; then
            VERSION="${{ github.ref_name }}"
            echo "version=${VERSION#v}" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          else
            VERSION=$(grep -o '"version"[[:space:]]*:[[:space:]]*"[^"]*"' installer/shared/version.json | cut -d'"' -f4)
            echo "version=$VERSION" >> $GITHUB_OUTPUT
          fi

  # Build CCX package (shared by both platforms)
  build-ccx:
    name: Build CCX Package
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: version
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Build CCX
        run: |
          chmod +x installer/scripts/build-ccx.sh
          ./installer/scripts/build-ccx.sh
        env:
          VERSION: ${{ needs.version.outputs.version }}

      - name: Upload CCX artifact
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: splice-uxp-ccx
          path: installer/shared/splice-uxp.ccx
          retention-days: 30

  # Build macOS PKG installer
  build-macos:
    name: Build macOS Installer
    runs-on: macos-latest
    needs: [version, build-ccx]
    steps:
      - name: Checkout
        uses: actions/checkout@v4

      - name: Download CCX artifact
        uses: actions/download-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: splice-uxp-ccx
          path: installer/shared/

      - name: Setup Node.js
        uses: actions/setup-node@v4
        with:
          node-version: ${{ env.NODE_VERSION }}

      - name: Install dependencies
        run: |
          cd installer
          npm ci

      - name: Import signing certificate
        if: ${{ github.event.inputs.sign_macos == 'true' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/tags/') }}
        env:
          MACOS_CERTIFICATE: ${{ secrets.MACOS_CERTIFICATE }}
          MACOS_CERTIFICATE_PWD: ${{ secrets.MACOS_CERTIFICATE_PWD }}
          KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD }}
        run: |
          # Create temporary keychain
          KEYCHAIN_PATH=$RUNNER_TEMP/signing.keychain-db
          security create-keychain -p "$KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD" $KEYCHAIN_PATH
          security set-keychain-settings -lut 21600 $KEYCHAIN_PATH
          security unlock-keychain -p "$KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD" $KEYCHAIN_PATH
          
          # Import certificate
          echo "$MACOS_CERTIFICATE" | base64 --decode > certificate.p12
          security import certificate.p12 -P "$MACOS_CERTIFICATE_PWD" -A -t cert -f pkcs12 -k $KEYCHAIN_PATH
          security list-keychain -d user -s $KEYCHAIN_PATH
          
          # Allow productsign to use the key
          security set-key-partition-list -S apple-tool:,apple:,codesign: -s -k "$KEYCHAIN_PASSWORD" $KEYCHAIN_PATH
          
          # Clean up
          rm certificate.p12

      - name: Build PKG installer
        run: |
          chmod +x installer/macos/build-pkg.sh
          ./installer/macos/build-pkg.sh $SIGN_ARGS $NOTARIZE_ARGS
        env:
          VERSION: ${{ needs.version.outputs.version }}
          SIGN_ARGS: ${{ (github.event.inputs.sign_macos == 'true' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/tags/')) && format('--sign "{0}"', secrets.MACOS_SIGNING_IDENTITY) || '' }}
          NOTARIZE_ARGS: ${{ (github.event.inputs.notarize_macos == 'true' || startsWith(github.ref, 'refs/tags/')) && '--notarize' || '' }}
          APPLE_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_ID }}
          TEAM_ID: ${{ secrets.APPLE_TEAM_ID }}
          APP_PASSWORD: ${{ secrets.APPLE_APP_PASSWORD }}

      - name: Upload macOS installer
        uses: actions/upload-artifact@v4
        with:
          name: splice-installer-macos
          path: dist/SPLICE-Installer-*.pkg
          retention-days: 30

  # Build Windows NSIS installer

## Complete Report: CEP Plugin Installer, Packaging, and Build Process

### OVERVIEW

The SPLICE project has a comprehensive, multi-platform installer infrastructure built around macOS `.pkg` installers and Windows `.exe` installers (via NSIS). The system supports both CEP (Classic Extension Panel) and UXP (Unified Extensibility Platform) plugins for Adobe Premiere Pro.

---

### 1. **INSTALLER CORE FILES & STRUCTURE**

#### Main Directory: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/`

**Key Configuration Files:**
- `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/package.json` - NPM build system (v6.0.3)
- `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/shared/version.json` - Centralized version (6.0.3, bundleId: com.splice.panel)
- `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/INSTALL.md` - End-user installation guide
- `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/BUILD.md` - Complete build guide

#### macOS Installer Directory: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/macos/`

**Build Scripts:**
- `build-pkg.sh` - Master macOS .pkg build script
- `sign-and-notarize.sh` - Code signing and notarization tool
- `uninstall.sh` - Uninstaller script

**Configuration:**
- `distribution.xml` - macOS installer distribution configuration (productbuild format)
- `create-app-specific-password.md` - Apple signing credentials guide

**Resources:**
- `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/macos/resources/` - HTML UI files:
  - `welcome.html`
  - `readme.html`
  - `license.html`
  - `conclusion.html`
- `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/macos/resources/license.txt`

**Installation Scripts:**
- `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/macos/scripts/preinstall` - Pre-install cleanup
- `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/macos/scripts/postinstall` - Post-install permissions & cleanup

#### Windows Installer Directory: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/windows/`

**Build Configuration:**
- `splice-installer.nsi` - NSIS (Nullsoft Scriptable Install System) configuration
  - Defines installer UI, file placement, registry entries
  - Support for CEP (required) and UXP (optional) components
  - Creates Start Menu shortcuts
  - Handles uninstallation

#### Shared Assets: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/shared/`

- `version.json` - Central version repository
- `assets/installer-icon.ico` - Installer icon
- `assets/uninstaller-icon.ico` - Uninstaller icon
- `assets/license.txt` - License agreement
- `splice-uxp.ccx` - Packaged UXP plugin

#### CI/CD Configuration: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/.github/workflows/`

- `build-installers.yml` - GitHub Actions workflow for automated builds

---

### 2. **CEP EXTENSION MANIFEST FILES**

#### Primary Manifest: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-cep/CSXS/manifest.xml`

**Key Attributes:**
```xml
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<ExtensionManifest xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
                   ExtensionBundleId="com.splice.panel"
                   ExtensionBundleVersion="6.0.3"
                   Version="7.0">
```

**Host Configuration:**
- Targets Adobe Premiere Pro (PPRO) v14.0+
- CSXS Runtime v12.0
- Panel UI: 400x800px (min: 300x400, max: 800x2000)

**Resources:**
- Main UI: `./panel/index.html`
- JSX Host Script: `./jsx/hostScript.jsx`
- Panel Icons: Light & Dark variants

#### Debug Configuration: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-cep/.debug`

XML configuration file for debug mode settings in Premiere Pro.

---

### 3. **BUILD SCRIPTS & ORCHESTRATION**

#### Master Build Scripts: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/build/scripts/`

**Main Orchestrator:**
- `build-all.sh` - Coordinates entire build process across all platforms
  - Supports `--dev` (development, no signing)
  - Supports `--skip-sign`, `--skip-macos`, `--skip-windows` options
  - Extracts version from `manifest.xml`
  - Manages certificate checking

**Platform-Specific Builders:**

1. **macOS:** `build-macos.sh`
   - Uses `pkgbuild` and `productbuild` (Xcode CLT)
   - Creates component packages
   - Builds final `.pkg` archive
   - Optional signing with Developer ID Installer certificate
   - Optional notarization via Apple's notary service

2. **Windows:** `build-windows.sh`
   - Uses NSIS (makensis) for .exe creation
   - Cross-platform compatible (runs on macOS/Linux with NSIS installed)
   - Optional code signing via Windows certificate

**Extension Signing:**
- `sign-extension.sh` - Signs CEP with ZXPSignCmd
  - Creates `.zxp` format files
  - Uses P12 certificates
  - Development builds as unsigned .zip

**Certificate Management:**
- `create-certificate.sh` - Self-signed certificate generation
- `setup-apple-signing.sh` - Interactive Apple signing setup

**Deployment:**
- `deploy-installers.sh` - Copies built installers to website's public downloads

---

### 4. **PACKAGE DEFINITION & DISTRIBUTION FILES**

#### Distribution Configuration: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/macos/distribution.xml`

**Package References:**
- `com.splice.panel.cep` - CEP extension package (v6.0.3, 10MB, requires auth)
- `com.splice.panel.uxp` - UXP plugin package (v6.0.3, 5MB, requires auth)

**Installation Checks:**
- Prevents installation if Premiere Pro is running
- Ensures 50MB minimum free disk space
- Supports system-wide and current user installation

**Installer UI Flow:**
- Welcome screen
- License agreement (HTML)
- Installation type selection
- Progress & completion screens

#### NSIS Configuration: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/windows/splice-installer.nsi`

**Sections:**
- SPLICE CEP Extension (required)
- SPLICE UXP Plugin (optional)
- Create Shortcuts

**Installation Paths:**
- CEP: `${CEP_EXTENSIONS_PATH}\${BUNDLE_ID}` (typically `C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Adobe\CEP\extensions\com.splice.panel`)
- UXP: Via Adobe's Unified Plugin Installer Agent (UPIA)

**Registry Integration:**
- Writes uninstall information to `HKLM\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Uninstall\`
- Stores CEP installation path

---

### 5. **CODE SIGNING CONFIGURATIONS**

#### macOS Signing: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/build/APPLE_SIGNING_GUIDE.md`

**Requirements:**
- Apple Developer Program ($99/year)
- Developer ID Installer certificate (NOT Developer ID Application)
- App-specific password (2FA required)
- Team ID

**Process:**
1. Sign with `productsign` command
2. Submit to Apple notary service via `xcrun notarytool`
3. Staple notarization ticket with `xcrun stapler`
4. Verify with `spctl` (Gatekeeper assessment)

**Storage:**
- Credentials stored in `.env.apple-signing` (git-ignored)
- Alternative: Store in macOS Keychain

#### Windows Signing:

**Certificate Types:**
- Standard code signing certificate ($200-500/year)
- Extended Validation (EV) certificate (higher cost, immediate reputation)

**Tools:**
- `signtool.exe` (Windows SDK)
- `osslsigncode` (cross-platform alternative)

---

### 6. **OUTPUT ARTIFACTS**

#### Signed Outputs: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/build/output/`

**Generated Files:**
- `SPLICE-v6.0.3.pkg` - Signed macOS installer
- `SPLICE-v6.0.3-Setup.exe` - Signed Windows installer
- `SPLICE-v6.0.3.zxp` - Signed CEP extension (manual installation)
- `SPLICE-v6.0.3-dev.zip` - Unsigned development build
- `SPLICE-v6.0.3.ccx` - UXP plugin package

#### Website Deployment: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/splice-website/public/downloads/`

**Deployed Files:**
- `splice-cep-v6.0.3.pkg`
- `splice-uxp-v6.0.3.pkg`
- `SPLICE-Installer-6.0.3.pkg` (combined)
- `SPLICE-v6.0.3.ccx`

---

### 7. **CI/CD AUTOMATION**

#### GitHub Actions Workflow: `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/.github/workflows/build-installers.yml`

**Triggers:**
- Tags: `v*` (automatic signed builds)
- Branch pushes: `main` and `release/*`
- Pull requests: unsigned builds
- Manual dispatch with signing options

**Build Jobs:**
1. **Version Detection** - Extracts from tag or `version.json`
2. **Build CCX** - Creates UXP plugin (ubuntu-latest)
3. **Build macOS** - Creates .pkg (macos-latest)
4. **Build Windows** - Creates .exe (windows-latest)

**Signing Integration:**
- Imports macOS certificates into temporary keychain
- Uses GitHub Secrets for credentials
- Runs notarization for tagged releases

**Artifacts:**
- 30-day retention for artifacts
- Upload to draft releases

---

### 8. **KEY CONFIGURATION DETAILS**

**Bundle Information:**
- Bundle ID: `com.splice.panel`
- Organization: `com.splice`
- Product Name: `SPLICE - AI Video Editor`
- Version: `6.0.3`

**Platform Support:**
- macOS: 10.14+ (Xcode CLT required)
- Windows: Windows 10+
- Adobe Premiere Pro: 14.0-24.x (CEP), 25.0+ (UXP)

**Installation Locations:**
- macOS CEP: `/Library/Application Support/Adobe/CEP/extensions/com.splice.panel/`
- Windows CEP: `C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files\Adobe\CEP\extensions\com.splice.panel\`
- UXP: Adobe Creative Cloud managed

---

### 9. **INSTALLER TESTING**

**Installation Test Report:** `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/INSTALLER-TEST-REPORT.md`

Contains test results and verification procedures for all platforms.

---

### 10. **NPM SCRIPTS**

From `/Users/imorgado/SPLICE/installer/package.json`:

```bash
npm run build          # Full build (all.js)
npm run build:mac      # macOS only
npm run build:win      # Windows only
npm run build:ccx      # CCX packaging

```
